original: nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i rkyen ma tshang bas skye ba 'byung ba med do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i rkyen ma tshang bas skye ba 'byung ba med do //
translated: But when the conditions for the afflictions are not complete, birth does not occur.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone objects:

original: ji ltar sa bon mtha' mthong zhing //
analyzed: ji ltar sa bon mtha' mthong zhing //
translated: Just as the end of a seed is not seen

original: de yi thog ma mi mngon ltar //
analyzed: de yi thog ma mi mngon ltar //
translated: and its beginning is not seen,

original: de bzhin rkyen dag ma tshang bas //
analyzed: de bzhin rkyen dag ma tshang bas //
translated: so too, because the conditions are incomplete,

original: skye ba yang ni mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: skye ba yang ni mi 'byung ngo //
translated: birth does not occur.

original: gang la rgyu yi thog mthong ba //
analyzed: gang la rgyu yi thog mthong ba //
translated: For what is the beginning of a cause

original: gang gi tha ma mthong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gang gi tha ma mthong bar 'gyur //
translated: that is seen to have an end?

original: sgra dang me lce sogs kun gyi //
analyzed: sgra dang me lce sogs kun gyi //
translated: The end of all things, such as sound and a flame,

original: mtha' mthong thog ma nyid yin no //
analyzed: mtha' mthong thog ma nyid yin no //
translated: is seen to be its beginning.

original: de ltar na skye ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i tha ma mi 'gal te /
analyzed: de ltar na skye ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i tha ma mi 'gal te /
translated: Thus, the end of the continuum of birth is not contradictory,

original: rgyu la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it depends on a cause.üîΩThus, the three states of the continuum of the aggregates are taught,

original: de ltar phung po'i rgyun skye ba'i gnas skabs gsum bstan pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol nas 'jig rten 'di dang / yang 'jig rten 'di nas pha rol du zhes bya ba de lta bu'o //
analyzed: de ltar phung po'i rgyun skye ba'i gnas skabs gsum bstan pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol nas 'jig rten 'di dang / yang 'jig rten 'di nas pha rol du zhes bya ba de lta bu'o //
translated: from the other world to this world and from this world to the other world.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'di yang sems can du ston pa yin par 'dod kyi /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'di yang sems can du ston pa yin par 'dod kyi /
translated: And this dependent origination is accepted as being taught with reference to sentient beings,

original: sems can du ston pa ma yin pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sems can du ston pa ma yin pa ni ma yin te /
translated: not as not being taught with reference to sentient beings,

original: de 'jig rten pha rol nas 'pho bar mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'jig rten pha rol nas 'pho bar mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not tenable that sentient beings transmigrate from a former world to this one.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bstan pa ni rgyu med pa dang / rgyu mi mthun pa dgag par bya ba'i phyir yin la /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bstan pa ni rgyu med pa dang / rgyu mi mthun pa dgag par bya ba'i phyir yin la /
translated: The teaching of dependent origination is for the purpose of refuting the view that things arise causelessly and from incompatible causes.

original: rten cing 'bral bar 'byung ba'i don ni 'khor ba 'jug pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: rten cing 'bral bar 'byung ba'i don ni 'khor ba 'jug pa'i don yin no //
translated: And the meaning of dependent origination is the meaning of the engagement of cyclic existence.

original: ci'i phyir mdo las sems can du ston pa kho na bstan ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mdo las sems can du ston pa kho na bstan ce na /
translated: Why is it taught in the sutras with reference to sentient beings?

original: 'di ltar sems can du ston pa dag la ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i rigs la /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can du ston pa dag la ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i rigs la /
translated: Because it is in those taught with reference to sentient beings that the afflictions and purification are possible.

original: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis gdul ba dag la bstan par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis gdul ba dag la bstan par bya ba yin te /
translated: And the Bhagavat taught that to those to be tamed,

original: sangs rgyas rnams 'byung ba ni de'i don kho nar yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams 'byung ba ni de'i don kho nar yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the arising of the buddhas is only for that purpose.

original: des na te por chen po yin pa'i phyir mdo las sems can du ston pa kho na bstan to //
analyzed: des na te por chen po yin pa'i phyir mdo las sems can du ston pa kho na bstan to //
translated: Therefore, in the sutra, only sentient beings are taught, because they are the most important.

original: bstan bcos las ni chos nyid kyi rjes su 'brangs te /
analyzed: bstan bcos las ni chos nyid kyi rjes su 'brangs te /
translated: But in the treatise, the teaching is in accordance with reality.

original: sems can dang sems can du @286b ston pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems can dang sems can du @286b ston pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: There are sentient beings and non-sentient beings.

original: yan lag bcu gnyis zhes bya ba ni rgyu bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: yan lag bcu gnyis zhes bya ba ni rgyu bcu gnyis so //
translated: The twelve members are the twelve causes.

original: cha gsum zhes bya ba ni dum bur yongs su bcad pa gsum mo //
analyzed: cha gsum zhes bya ba ni dum bur yongs su bcad pa gsum mo //
translated: The three parts are the three sections.

original: lhag ma brgyad ni bar du'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor pa dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dag go //üîΩyang na ci thams cad kyi zhes bya ba ni khyad par med par mngal du 'jug pa tsam la brten pa rnams kyi 'am /
analyzed: lhag ma brgyad ni bar du'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor pa dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dag go // yang na ci thams cad kyi zhes bya ba ni khyad par med par mngal du 'jug pa tsam la brten pa rnams kyi 'am /
translated: The remaining eight are in the middle: consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, and becoming.üîΩOr, does it apply to all?

original: khams gsum pa'i sems can rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i sems can rnams kyi'o //
translated: It applies to all sentient beings of the three realms, without distinction.

original: skye ba 'di la zhes bya ba ni mang la du 'jug pa'i skye ba la'o ;
analyzed: skye ba 'di la zhes bya ba ni mang la du 'jug pa'i skye ba la'o ;
translated: In this birth means in the birth of entering the womb.

original: / gang bar ma dor 'chi ba yang ma yin la zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: / gang bar ma dor 'chi ba yang ma yin la zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is not that which dies in the middle.

original: gang zhig srid pa'i gnas skabs ma thob par 'chi ba de la ni bar ma dor 'chi ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig srid pa'i gnas skabs ma thob par 'chi ba de la ni bar ma dor 'chi ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That which dies without having attained the stage of existence is called ‚Äúthat which dies in the middle.‚Äù

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa ni spyod pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa ni spyod pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is not that which has form or is formless.

original: gzugs na spyod pa la ni rnam par shes pa dang skye mched drug gi gnas skabs las tha dad pa'i ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs med de /
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa la ni rnam par shes pa dang skye mched drug gi gnas skabs las tha dad pa'i ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs med de /
translated: In the realm of form, there is no stage of name-and-form separate from the stage of consciousness and the six sense bases.üîΩAs will be explained:

original: 'di ltar / ming dang gzugs ni de phan chad //
analyzed: 'di ltar / ming dang gzugs ni de phan chad //
translated: Name-and-form is from then on,

original: skye mched drug dod tshun chad do //üîΩzhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye mched drug dod tshun chad do // zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: up to the formation of the six sense bases.

original: de'i phyir gzugs kyi khams na yan lag bcu gnyis med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs kyi khams na yan lag bcu gnyis med do //
translated: Therefore, the twelve members are not in the realm of form.

original: gzugs med pa na spyod pa la ni ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs dang / skye mched drug gi gnas skabs yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa na spyod pa la ni ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs dang / skye mched drug gi gnas skabs yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In the formless realm, there is no stage of name-and-form and no stage of the six sense bases.

original: gzugs med pas de dag med do //
analyzed: gzugs med pas de dag med do //
translated: Because there is no form, those two do not exist.

original: de'i phyir yan lag bcu yod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir yan lag bcu yod do //
translated: Therefore, there are ten members.

original: 'di ltar gleng gzhi chen po chos kyi rnam grangs las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gleng gzhi chen po chos kyi rnam grangs las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Thus, the great basis for the sutra statement, ‚Äúfrom the Dharma teaching called the great basis for the sutra statement,

original: kun dga' bo gal te rnam par shes pa ma'i mngal du zhugs par ma gyur na /
analyzed: kun dga' bo gal te rnam par shes pa ma'i mngal du zhugs par ma gyur na /
translated: if consciousness does not enter the mother‚Äôs womb,üîΩwould that consciousness increase, grow, and mature?‚Äù

original: rnam par shes pa de 'phel ba dang rgyas pa dang yangs par 'gyur ram zhes 'byung ba'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams las ma gtogs par ma'i mngal du 'jug pa nyid mi srid do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de 'phel ba dang rgyas pa dang yangs par 'gyur ram zhes 'byung ba'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams las ma gtogs par ma'i mngal du 'jug pa nyid mi srid do //
translated: Therefore, it is impossible to enter the mother‚Äôs womb except from the desire realm.

original: de lta na gang zag thams cad kyi dbang du byas nas srid pa'i yan lag gi rnam par gzhag pa 'khrug par 'gyur ro //üîΩsngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' 'bras bu dang rgyu dang bcas pa dag smos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de lta na gang zag thams cad kyi dbang du byas nas srid pa'i yan lag gi rnam par gzhag pa 'khrug par 'gyur ro // sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' 'bras bu dang rgyu dang bcas pa dag smos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: If that were so, the presentation of the members of existence would be disrupted in terms of all sentient beings.üîΩBecause the sutra mentions the prior limit and the subsequent limit together with their effects and causes.

original: sngon gyi mtha' 'bras bu dang @287a * //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' 'bras bu dang @287a * //
translated: The prior limit is the effect

original: bcas pa dang / phyi ma'i mtha' rgyu dang bcas pa smos pa'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis dang cha gsum pa de nyid sngon gyi mtha' pa dang phyi ma'i mtha' pa dang rnam pa gnyis su brjod do //
analyzed: bcas pa dang / phyi ma'i mtha' rgyu dang bcas pa smos pa'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis dang cha gsum pa de nyid sngon gyi mtha' pa dang phyi ma'i mtha' pa dang rnam pa gnyis su brjod do //
translated: and the future end with its cause, the twelve members of dependent origination are said to be threefold, with two aspects: the past, the future, and the present.

original: de la sngon gyi mtha' pa ni ma rig pa dang 'du byed do ;
analyzed: de la sngon gyi mtha' pa ni ma rig pa dang 'du byed do ;
translated: The past is ignorance and the conditioning.

original: / de'i 'bras bu ni rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba'i yan lag rnams te /
analyzed: / de'i 'bras bu ni rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba'i yan lag rnams te /
translated: The effect of the past is the members of consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, and feeling.

original: de lta na yan lag bdun ni sngon gyi mtha' pa'o //
analyzed: de lta na yan lag bdun ni sngon gyi mtha' pa'o //
translated: Thus, seven members are the past.

original: phyi ma'i mtha' pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the future?

original: skye ba dang rga shi'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang rga shi'o //
translated: Birth and aging-and-death.

original: de'i rgyu ni sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa'i yan lag rnams te /üîΩde lta na yan lag lnga ni /
analyzed: de'i rgyu ni sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa'i yan lag rnams te / de lta na yan lag lnga ni /
translated: The cause of the future is the members of craving, grasping, and becoming.

original: phyi ma'i mtha' pa'o //
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' pa'o //
translated: Thus, five members are the future.

original: yang ma rig pa la sogs pa 'di gang zhig ce na zhes bya ba ni ci ma rig pa ni mi shes pa zhig kho na 'am /
analyzed: yang ma rig pa la sogs pa 'di gang zhig ce na zhes bya ba ni ci ma rig pa ni mi shes pa zhig kho na 'am /
translated: Again, what is this ignorance, etc.?

original: 'on te nyon mongs pa thams cad yin snyam nas 'dri ba ste /
analyzed: 'on te nyon mongs pa thams cad yin snyam nas 'dri ba ste /
translated: This is asked because one wonders whether ignorance is just non-knowledge or whether it is all the defilements.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said of the others.

original: de'i phyir ma rig nyon mongs sngon gnas skabs zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma rig nyon mongs sngon gnas skabs zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚Äúignorance is the state of defilement at the prior stage.‚Äù

original: sngon zhes bya ba smos pa ni da ltar ba sred pa dang len pas bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon zhes bya ba smos pa ni da ltar ba sred pa dang len pas bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúprior‚Äù is used because craving and grasping are included in the present.

original: yang ci'i phyir nyon mongs pa thams cad ma rig pa'i sgras brjod ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir nyon mongs pa thams cad ma rig pa'i sgras brjod ce na /
translated: Again, why are all the defilements referred to by the word ‚Äúignorance‚Äù?

original: yang srid pa 'phen pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi rgyu'i ngo bor nges pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'dod chags la sogs pa rnams ni de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: yang srid pa 'phen pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi rgyu'i ngo bor nges pa'i phyir ro // 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams ni de ltar ma yin te /
translated: Because they are ascertained as the cause of the formative forces that impel renewed existence.üîΩBut this is not so for attachment, etc.

original: 'di ltar 'dod chags ni zhe sdang gis mngon par 'du byas pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod chags ni zhe sdang gis mngon par 'du byas pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi rgyu ma yin no //
translated: For example, attachment is not the cause of the formative forces that are instigated by hatred.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said of the other [links].

original: ma rig pa ni gdon mi za ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa ni gdon mi za ste /
translated: Undoubtedly, ignorance is the root of cyclic existence.

original: de ni nyon mongs pa thams cad dang lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni nyon mongs pa thams cad dang lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the universal co-existent cause of all the defilements.

original: des gzhag pa'i nus pa'i shugs dang ldan pa'i phyir yang ma rig pa'i phyogs la brten te /
analyzed: des gzhag pa'i nus pa'i shugs dang ldan pa'i phyir yang ma rig pa'i phyogs la brten te /
translated: And because it is the power that establishes the latent impressions, it is the basis of ignorance.

original: de'i phyir de'i sgras nyon mongs pa thams cad bsnyad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i sgras nyon mongs pa thams cad bsnyad do //
translated: Therefore, the term ‚Äúignorance‚Äù is used to refer to all the defilements.

original: 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: 'di ga las she na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ma rig pa gtso bo yin pa'i phyir dang / de dang lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa gtso bo yin pa'i phyir dang / de dang lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because ignorance is the principal [cause], and because it co-exists with [the other defilements].

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, [the root text] says, ‚Äúbecause of co-existence.‚Äù

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad ni ma rig pa dang mtshungs par ldan gyi /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad ni ma rig pa dang mtshungs par ldan gyi /
translated: All the defilements are concomitant with ignorance.

original: phan tshun ni ma yin te /
analyzed: phan tshun ni ma yin te /
translated: They are not mutually concomitant with each other.

original: de'i phyir ma rig pa dang lhan cig spyod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma rig pa dang lhan cig spyod pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, they are co-existent with ignorance.

original: de'i dbang gis zhes bya ba ni ma rig @287b pa'i dbang gis so //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis zhes bya ba ni ma rig @287b pa'i dbang gis so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy the power of that‚Äù means by the power of ignorance.

original: de dag ni nyon mongs pa dag go //
analyzed: de dag ni nyon mongs pa dag go //
translated: Those are the defilements.

original: kun du 'byung ba ni skye ba ste /
analyzed: kun du 'byung ba ni skye ba ste /
translated: The arising of the totality is birth.

original: ma rmongs pa la nyon mongs pa gzhan skye ba ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma rmongs pa la nyon mongs pa gzhan skye ba ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: When one is not deluded, the other defilements do not arise.

original: de nyid la dpe ni rgyal po gshegs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid la dpe ni rgyal po gshegs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The example for this is the statement: ‚ÄúThe king is coming!‚Äù

original: zha 'bring ba ni /
analyzed: zha 'bring ba ni /
translated: The intermediate is

original: rgyal po dang lhan cig spyod pa rnams te ;
analyzed: rgyal po dang lhan cig spyod pa rnams te ;
translated: those who are in the retinue of the king.

original: de'i dbang gis 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i phyir rgyal po gtso ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i phyir rgyal po gtso ba yin no //
translated: Because they go and return by the power of the king, the king is the principal.

original: 'du byed dag ni sngon las kyi //
analyzed: 'du byed dag ni sngon las kyi //
translated: The formations are the previous action.

original: zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
translated: This is stated.

original: 'dir ma rig pa dang 'du byed 'bras bu phyung zin pa rnams kho na yan lag nyid du rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: 'dir ma rig pa dang 'du byed 'bras bu phyung zin pa rnams kho na yan lag nyid du rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Here, ignorance and the formations that have already produced their effects are established as members.

original: 'bras bu ma byung ba rnams la ni sred pa dang len pa dang srid pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ma byung ba rnams la ni sred pa dang len pa dang srid pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Those that have not produced their effects are called craving, grasping, and becoming.

original: bsod nams la sogs pa'i las kyi gnas skabs zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsod nams la sogs pa'i las kyi gnas skabs zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The state of meritorious and so on

original: bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i las kyi gnas skabs so //
analyzed: bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i las kyi gnas skabs so //
translated: means the state of meritorious, nonmeritorious, and unshakable action.

original: rnam shes mtshams sbyor phung po yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam shes mtshams sbyor phung po yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The aggregates at the time of linking are consciousness.

original: de'i tshe rnam par shes pa gtso bo yin pa'i phyir dang / lhag ma rnams rnam par shes pa dang / lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa mos pas bsdus so //
analyzed: de'i tshe rnam par shes pa gtso bo yin pa'i phyir dang / lhag ma rnams rnam par shes pa dang / lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa mos pas bsdus so //
translated: At that time, consciousness is predominant, and the remaining aggregates accompany consciousness, which is included in name.

original: ma'i mngal du zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i srid par nyid mtshams sbyor ba nyid na'o //
analyzed: ma'i mngal du zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i srid par nyid mtshams sbyor ba nyid na'o //
translated: In the mother‚Äôs womb refers to the linking of consciousness in the birth existence.

original: de ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa kho na ste /
translated: It is only mental consciousness,

original: de'i tshe snga ma rnams kyi rkyen med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe snga ma rnams kyi rkyen med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because at that time the conditions for the other forms of consciousness are absent.

original: 'dir rnam par shes pa dang skye ba'i yan lag gnyis ni skad cig ma yin la /
analyzed: 'dir rnam par shes pa dang skye ba'i yan lag gnyis ni skad cig ma yin la /
translated: Here, the two members of consciousness and birth are momentary.

original: gzhan dag ni rgyun chags pa yin pa'i phyir skad cig ma mang po dag yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni rgyun chags pa yin pa'i phyir skad cig ma mang po dag yin no //
translated: The others are many moments because they are a continuum.

original: ming dang gzugs ni de phan chad ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs ni de phan chad ces bya ba la /
translated: Name-and-form is from then on.

original: 'di ni gnas skabs la gzhag pa yin gyi chos nyid la gzhag pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni gnas skabs la gzhag pa yin gyi chos nyid la gzhag pa ni ma yin no //
translated: This is posited in terms of the period of development, not in terms of reality.

original: gnas pa dang skye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /üîΩslob dpon dpal len na re go rims bzhin du gnas pa yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir dang / skye ba yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir rnam grangs gnyis gsungs so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gnas pa dang skye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / slob dpon dpal len na re go rims bzhin du gnas pa yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir dang / skye ba yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir rnam grangs gnyis gsungs so zhes zer ro //
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says, if ignorance is not abandoned, etc.

original: de nyid @301b bstan pa'i phyir rgyu'i rgyu na ji srid pa de srid du 'bras bu'i rgyun 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de nyid @301b bstan pa'i phyir rgyu'i rgyu na ji srid pa de srid du 'bras bu'i rgyun 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smos te /

original: rnam grangs dang pos bstan to //
analyzed: rnam grangs dang pos bstan to //
translated: The first alternative is demonstrated.

original: rgyu nyid skyes pas 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs gnyis par bstan to //
analyzed: rgyu nyid skyes pas 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs gnyis par bstan to //

original: 'byung ba'i dbang du mdzad pa yin na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i dbang du mdzad pa yin na zhes bya ba la /
translated: If it were in terms of emergence,

original: 'dir ni dge slong dag khyed la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bstan par bya'o zhes rgyas par rten cing 'brel pa'i dbang du byas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni dge slong dag khyed la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bstan par bya'o zhes rgyas par rten cing 'brel pa'i dbang du byas pa yin te /

original: der gnas pa'i dbang du ma mdzad pa'i phyir gnas pa'i tshig gi go skabs ci zhig yod /üîΩrim pa mi mthun pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: der gnas pa'i dbang du ma mdzad pa'i phyir gnas pa'i tshig gi go skabs ci zhig yod / rim pa mi mthun pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /

analyzed: gnas pa'i skye ba sngon du 'gro ba can yin te /

original: de'i phyir sngar ni 'di skyes pas 'di skye zhes bya ba kho na brjod par bya ba la phyis ni 'di yod pas 'di 'byung zhes gnas pas brjod par bya ba'am /

original: go rims las rgal na yang dgos pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: go rims las rgal na yang dgos pa brjod par bya'o //

original: yang smras pa zhes bya ba ni gnas brtan de nyid kyis so //
analyzed: yang smras pa zhes bya ba ni gnas brtan de nyid kyis so //
translated: Again, the elder said

original: gal te mdo'i don de yin par 'gyur na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la 'di yod pas zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu yod pas so //
analyzed: gal te mdo'i don de yin par 'gyur na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la 'di yod pas zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu yod pas so //
translated: If that were the meaning of the sutra, then it would say, ‚ÄúBecause this exists, that arises,‚Äù and it would say, ‚ÄúBecause this does not exist, that does not occur.‚Äù

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni rgyu ste /
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni rgyu ste /

analyzed: the tshom med pa'i phyir mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba de skad du bka' stsal par 'gyur te /

original: bcom ldan 'das the tshom za bar gsungs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das the tshom za bar gsungs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: but the BhagavƒÅn did not say, ‚ÄúBecause of doubt.‚Äù

original: 'bras bu yod na phyis rgyu 'jig par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu yod na phyis rgyu 'jig par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: If the effect exists, the cause does not subsequently disintegrate.

original: skye dang 'jig pa dag mnyam ste //
analyzed: skye dang 'jig pa dag mnyam ste //
translated: Arising and disintegration are equal,

original: srang mda'i mthon dman ji bzhin no //üîΩzhes 'byung bas /
analyzed: srang mda'i mthon dman ji bzhin no // zhes 'byung bas /

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis cig car du ma yin par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis cig car du ma yin par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, it is accepted that cause and effect do not occur simultaneously.

original: de lta na go rims legs pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de lta na go rims legs pa yin no zhes bya ba la /

original: 'jig pa skye ba sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir dang / de yang sngar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa skye ba sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir dang / de yang sngar bstan pa'i phyir ro //

original: gzhan du na zhes bya ba ni gal te sngar 'jig pa bstan te /
analyzed: gzhan du na zhes bya ba ni gal te sngar 'jig pa bstan te /
translated: Otherwise, if it were not so, then if disintegration were taught first,üîΩ

analyzed: de'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang zhe na zhes dri ba mdzad nas 'di lta ste 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes bya bar gang las 'bras bu yod na rgyu 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes de skad 'chad par 'gyur ba /
translated: Otherwise, if the destruction of the effect were to occur prior to the cause, then the question ‚ÄúWhat is dependent origination?‚Äù would be asked, and the answer ‚ÄúWhen this exists, that comes to be‚Äù would be given.

original: 'jig pa'i tshig tu thal ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i tshig tu thal ba ci zhig yod /
translated: How could the word ‚Äúdestruction‚Äù be used?

original: de'i phyir dpal len gyis legs par mi smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir dpal len gyis legs par mi smras so //
translated: Therefore, it is not well said by the glorious DharmapƒÅla.

original: byis pa ni rten cing 'brel @302a * //üîΩpar 'byung ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: byis pa ni rten cing 'brel @302a * // par 'byung ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The childish, not seeing dependent origination,

original: byis pa zhes bya ba ni bden pa ma mthong ba'o //
analyzed: byis pa zhes bya ba ni bden pa ma mthong ba'o //
translated: The childish, not seeing the truth,

original: 'du byed tsam zhes bya ba tsam gyi sgra ni 'di na 'du byed pa po bdag la sogs pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du byed tsam zhes bya ba tsam gyi sgra ni 'di na 'du byed pa po bdag la sogs pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúmere‚Äù in ‚Äúmere conditioning‚Äù is used to show that the self and so on, the agent of conditioning, do not exist.

analyzed: mi shes pas zhes bya bas ni ma 'dres pa'i ma rig pa bstan to //

original: bdag tu lta ba dang nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal la mngon par zhen cing zhes bya ba ni bdag tu lta ba dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dag la rab tu gnas shing zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba dang nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal la mngon par zhen cing zhes bya ba ni bdag tu lta ba dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dag la rab tu gnas shing zhes bya ba'i don te /

analyzed: 'dis ni bdag tu lta ba dang nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ma rig pa bstan to //
translated: This passage shows that ignorance is associated with the view of a real self and the pride that thinks ‚ÄúI am.‚Äù

original: lus la sogs pa dag gi las rnam pa gsum rtsom ste zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa dag gi las rnam pa gsum rtsom ste zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //

analyzed: bdag nyid ces bya ba ni gang du 'di dag go snyam du lta ba dang / gang gis rlom pa de'o /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin regard to themselves‚Äù means in regard to that which is viewed as a self and in regard to that which is inflated with pride.

original: bde ba'i don tam //
analyzed: bde ba'i don tam //

analyzed: bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang mi g-yo ba'i mtshan nyid can rtsom mo //

analyzed: bsod nams zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge ba ste /

analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten pha rol du bde ba 'dod pa ni sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa dag la 'jug go //
translated: Thus, one who desires happiness in the next world engages in generosity, morality, and so on.

original: de skad du ni phal che ba'i sgo nas bstan te /üîΩlog pa'i rnam par rtog pa dus ches yun ring pos /üîΩrjes su 'brel pas blo gros yul 'dzin pa dang bral zhing gti mug chen po'i mig ser gyi tshogs chen pos sems kyi mig nyams pa lta ba ngan pas bslus pa kha cig tshe phyi ma la bde ba'i don du mchod sbyin la sogs pa bsod nams ma

original: bde ba dang bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i don du mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bde ba dang bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i don du mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni /

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa ste /üîΩbsam gtan gsum pa'i bar du tshe phyi ma la bde ba'i don da nga de'i gong du bde ba yang ma @302b yin ;
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa ste / bsam gtan gsum pa'i bar du tshe phyi ma la bde ba'i don da nga de'i gong du bde ba yang ma @302b yin ;
translated: It is in the form and formless realms.üîΩUp to the third meditative absorption, it is for the sake of pleasure in

analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i don du'o //

analyzed: lus kyi sgo nas srog gcod pa la sogs pa dang / ngag gis brdzun smra ba la sogs pa dang / yid kyis brnab sems la sogs pa dag go //

original: las kyi 'phen pa'i dbang gis zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: las kyi 'phen pa'i dbang gis zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúBy the power of the projection of karma‚Äù meansüîΩthat which is projected by the previously mentioned karma is the projection

analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i las dag gis 'phangs pa ni las kyi 'phen pa'o //

analyzed: de'i dbang gis ni de'i rgyu mtshan gyis te /
translated: ‚ÄúBy the power of that‚Äù means by the reason of that.

analyzed: rgyu des rnam par shes pa'i rgyun srid pa bar ma dang 'brel bas thag shin tu ring yang 'gro ba de dang der 'gro bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: srid pa bar ma yang rnam par shes pa drug dang ldan pa'i phyir de ltar bshad na /

translated: If the continuum of consciousness that is completely imbued by karma is the consciousness that is the condition of formations from the moment of linking with the intermediate existence until the moment of birth, then it is logical to explain the consciousness that is taught in the presentation of the divisions of consciousness as the six collections of consciousness.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no //

original: de'i phyir / 'di skad du /

translated: It is the mental consciousness.‚ÄùüîΩBut it does not state that, and instead states:

analyzed: ming dang gzugs rnam par 'byed pa'i mdo las ming gang zhe na / gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po bzhi ste /

analyzed: tshor ba'i phung po nas rnam par shes pa'i phung po'i bar ro //

analyzed: smad pa'i shes rab ni nyon mongs pa can yin gyi /

original: de yang 'jig @305a * //üîΩtshogs la lta ba la sogs pa lta ba rnam pa lnga yin na /
analyzed: de yang 'jig @305a * // tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa lta ba rnam pa lnga yin na /

analyzed: de yang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang / nga rgyal la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin no //

analyzed: lta ba de dang mtshungs ldan phyir //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: shes rab kyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa yang de dang mtshungs par ldan pas ma rig pa chos gzhan yin par rigs kyi /

analyzed: shes rab kyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa shes rab nyid ni ma yin te /

original: 'dres na rnam par mi 'dag pas zhes bya ba ni shes rab dge ba ni mjug thogs su 'byung ba'i shes rab nyon mongs ba can dang 'dres na rnams par mi 'dag go zhes bya ba'o //üîΩde yang gdon mi za bar 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa yin nam ci zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang mtshungs par ldan nam zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: bag chags de zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa gnas ngan len gyi bag chags zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: ma rig pas nye bar bcom pa yang de bzhin du brtag par bya ste /

original: gang yang zhes bya ba ni slob dpon dpal len te /
analyzed: gang yang zhes bya ba ni slob dpon dpal len te /
translated: ‚ÄúWhatever‚Äù refers to the master Shrƒ´lƒÅta.üîΩ

analyzed: de ni nyon mongs pa thams cad ma rig pa yin no snyam du sems so //
translated: Master ≈örƒ´gupta thinks that any means all afflictions are ignorance.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gsum po che des rab tu mi shes shing rab tu mi shes pa ni ma rig pa zhes bya ba'i mdo'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because the S≈´tra on the Three Heaps says, ‚ÄúVenerable, that which is not known, not seen, not realized, not touched, not actualized by wisdom is called ignorance.‚Äù

original: / des zhes bya ba ni de yod na rig pa med par de ni ma rig pa ste /
analyzed: / des zhes bya ba ni de yod na rig pa med par de ni ma rig pa ste /

analyzed: rgyu med na ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin la /

original: phra rgyas lhag ma dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phra rgyas lhag ma dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //

translated: Because it is the nature of all the afflictions, it would not be explained separately as the view of the self, the extreme, and so on, and the entanglements of stinginess, deceit, and so on, because it is not distinct from the nature of the view of the self and so on and the entanglements of stinginess and so on.

analyzed: nyon mongs pa gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan par mi 'gyur ro zhes thams cad la brjod par bya'o //

analyzed: ma rig pas nye bar nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa'i zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: It should be applied as ‚Äúthe mind that is afflicted by ignorance.‚Äù

analyzed: 'on te bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la / nyon mongs pa thams cad ma rig pa'i rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir ma rig pa che ge mos nye bar nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa mi grol lo bya bar rtogs par mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir ma rig pa bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir 'dod
translated: Or, in order to make a distinction,

analyzed: chags kyis nye bar nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa'i zhes bshad de /
translated: since all afflictions are by nature ignorance, it would not be understood that the mind that is afflicted by such and such ignorance is not liberated. Therefore, in order to make a distinction, it is explained that the mind that is afflicted by attachment is liberated.

original: dper na skye mched bcu po dag gzugs kyi rang bzhin du khyad par med pa dang / bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir gzugs kyi skye mched dang sgra'i skye mched ces bshad pa bzhin no //

analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir bye brag nye bar mi len no zhe na /
translated: then the specific states of ignorance are not distinguished here.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: sems la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di ltar 'dod chags kho nas yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: sems la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro // 'di ltar 'dod chags kho nas yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: because the same is true of the mind.üîΩFor, it is not only due to passion that the mind is not liberated,

original: nyon mongs @306b pa gzhan dag gis nye bar nyon mongs par gyur pa'i sems kyang rnam par mi 'grol bas 'di ni mtshungs so //
analyzed: nyon mongs @306b pa gzhan dag gis nye bar nyon mongs par gyur pa'i sems kyang rnam par mi 'grol bas 'di ni mtshungs so //

original: mi gsal ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi gsal ba'o zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: gsal ba ni rab tu shes pa yin la /

analyzed: mi gsal ba ni gsal ba ma yin pa'o //

translated: If it is not clear, then it would follow, absurdly, that the eyes and so on are also nescience.

analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te / rkyen gyi dngos por bstan pa de lta bu'i phyir la /

analyzed: kun du sbyor ba la sogs pa'i dngos por bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because it is taught to be a fetter and so on.

analyzed: ji ltar 'di ci zhig ces ma rig pa mi shes pa de bzhin du mi gsal ba yang yin no zhes ston te /

analyzed: 'dir rig pa'i mi mthun phyogs kyi las kyis ma rig pa bstan te /

original: tshig bla dags zhes bya ba ni ming yin no zhes bya ba ni lha sbyin mchod sbyin zhes bya ba sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed de ;
analyzed: tshig bla dags zhes bya ba ni ming yin no zhes bya ba ni lha sbyin mchod sbyin zhes bya ba sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed de ;
translated: The term ‚Äúname‚Äù is a synonym for name.

original: de ni drug pa kho na'i yul yin gyi /
analyzed: de ni drug pa kho na'i yul yin gyi /
translated: It is the object of the sixth alone,

original: gzhan gyi ni ma yin no //üîΩde nyid rab tu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan gyi ni ma yin no // de nyid rab tu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: not of others.üîΩIn order to demonstrate just this, he says,

original: de lhag par 'di'i dmigs pa yin pas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de lhag par 'di'i dmigs pa yin pas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: because it is its special object.

original: grag ces bya ba'i sgra ni sgra las ma gtogs pa'i ming med par shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grag ces bya ba'i sgra ni sgra las ma gtogs pa'i ming med par shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúit is said‚Äù is used because it is understood that apart from sound there is no name.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pas ni sngon po rnam par shes kyi zhes bya ba ni brjod par bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pas ni sngon po rnam par shes kyi zhes bya ba ni brjod par bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The eye consciousness cognizes blue, but it does not cognize the expression ‚ÄúThis is blue.‚Äù

original: sngon po'o zhes bya bar ni rnam par mi shes so zhes bya ba ni ming gi sgo nas rnam par mi shes pa ste /
analyzed: sngon po'o zhes bya bar ni rnam par mi shes so zhes bya ba ni ming gi sgo nas rnam par mi shes pa ste /
translated: It does not cognize blue in the sense of a name.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni rnam par rtog pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni rnam par rtog pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because visual consciousness is non-conceptual.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pas ni rang gi ngo bo dang ming gnyis ka'i sgo nas rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pas ni rang gi ngo bo dang ming gnyis ka'i sgo nas rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: Mental consciousness cognizes both the intrinsic nature and the name.

original: des ni ming dang ming can gyi 'brel pa 'dzin par nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des ni ming dang ming can gyi 'brel pa 'dzin par nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is able to grasp the connection between the name and the bearer of the name.üîΩOne is distinguished by its basis,

original: gcig ni rten gyis rab tu phye ba yin no zhes bya ba ni thogs pa'i reg pa ste /
analyzed: gcig ni rten gyis rab tu phye ba yin no zhes bya ba ni thogs pa'i reg pa ste /
translated: which is contact through obstruction,

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa'i dbang po la brten pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa'i dbang po la brten pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because it is based on a sense faculty that is obstructed.

original: / gzhan dag na re ni rten dang dmigs pas rab tu phye ba yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: / gzhan dag na re ni rten dang dmigs pas rab tu phye ba yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say it is distinguished by both its basis and its object.üîΩThe second is distinguished by its object,

original: gnyis pa ni dmigs pas rab tu phye ba yin no zhes bya ba ni tshig bla dags kyi reg pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni dmigs pas rab tu phye ba yin no zhes bya ba ni tshig bla dags kyi reg pa ste /
translated: which is contact through designation.

original: lhag par tshig bla dags kyi dmigs pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag par tshig bla dags kyi dmigs pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the basis of the designation of words.

original: tshig gi dbang du byas nas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshig gi dbang du byas nas zhes bya ba la /
translated: With regard to words,

original: @310b nye bar bstan pas ming dang ming can gyi 'brel pa la byang ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i sgo nas bum pa dang snam bu zhes bya bar rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: @310b nye bar bstan pas ming dang ming can gyi 'brel pa la byang ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i sgo nas bum pa dang snam bu zhes bya bar rtog pa yin no //
translated: one who is skilled in the connection between the name and the thing named through instruction, imagines a pot or a cloth through the medium of the mental consciousness.

original: gnyis pa ni mtshungs par ldan pas rab tu phye ba yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni mtshungs par ldan pas rab tu phye ba yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The second is distinguished by its association.

original: tshig bla dags ni yid yin la de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i reg pa ni tshig bla dags kyi reg pa'o //üîΩrig dang ma rig ces bya ba la sogs pa la /üîΩrig pa zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i shes rab po //
analyzed: tshig bla dags ni yid yin la de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i reg pa ni tshig bla dags kyi reg pa'o // rig dang ma rig ces bya ba la sogs pa la / rig pa zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i shes rab po //
translated: The designation is the mental faculty, and the contact associated with it is contact through designation.üîΩWith regard to the statement, ‚Äúwith regard to knowledge and ignorance, etc.,‚ÄùüîΩknowledge is uncontaminated wisdom.

original: ma rig pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can gyi mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can gyi mi shes pa'o //
translated: Ignorance is defiled nescience.

original: rig pa yang ma yin ma rig pa yang ma yin pa ni shes rab dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa dang / shes rab ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rig pa yang ma yin ma rig pa yang ma yin pa ni shes rab dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa dang / shes rab ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ste /
translated: Contact that is neither knowledge nor ignorance is either virtuous wisdom that is contaminated or unobscured indeterminate wisdom.

original: de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa de dag ni rim pa bzhin du reg pa yin par rig par bya'o //üîΩma rig pa'i reg pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa de dag ni rim pa bzhin du reg pa yin par rig par bya'o // ma rig pa'i reg pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Contact should be understood as being associated with those, respectively.

original: ma rig pa'i reg pa ni nyon mongs pa thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i reg pa ni nyon mongs pa thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
translated: Contact associated with ignorance is contact associated with all the afflictions.

original: yang dang yang du 'byung ba ni rtag tu kun du 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: yang dang yang du 'byung ba ni rtag tu kun du 'byung ba ste /
translated: That which occurs again and again is contact that always occurs.

original: de'i phyogs gcig smos pas reg pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyogs gcig smos pas reg pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: Since one part of that is mentioned, contact is twofold:

original: gnod sems dang rjes su chags pa'i reg pa'o //
analyzed: gnod sems dang rjes su chags pa'i reg pa'o //
translated: contact that is malice and contact that is attachment.

original: ji ltar tshor ba bde ba dang mthun pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni tshor ba bde ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / tshor ba bde ba skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar tshor ba bde ba dang mthun pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni tshor ba bde ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / tshor ba bde ba skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because it is favorable to pleasant feeling. This means that it is favorable to pleasant feeling, or it produces pleasant feeling.

original: gzhan dag la yang de dang 'dra bar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang de dang 'dra bar brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said of the others.

original: ji ltar de bya ba'am bya bar nus par bya bar 'gyur ba yin pa de bzhin du de myong bar bya ba'am myong bar nus pa'i phyir myong bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar de bya ba'am bya bar nus par bya bar 'gyur ba yin pa de bzhin du de myong bar bya ba'am myong bar nus pa'i phyir myong bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Just as it is said that something is to be done or is capable of being done, in the same way it is said that something is to be experienced or is capable of being experienced.

original: de dag ni reg pa bcu drug yin no zhes bya ba ni mig gi 'dus te reg pa la sogs pa drug dang / thogs pa dang tshig bla dags kyi reg pa gnyis dang / rig pa dang ma rig pa dang gzhan gyi reg pa gsum dang /
analyzed: de dag ni reg pa bcu drug yin no zhes bya ba ni mig gi 'dus te reg pa la sogs pa drug dang / thogs pa dang tshig bla dags kyi reg pa gnyis dang / rig pa dang ma rig pa dang gzhan gyi reg pa gsum dang /
translated: These are the sixteen types of contact. The six beginning with eye contact, the two contacts of obstruction and designation, the three contacts of knowledge, ignorance, and other, and the five beginning with the contact of what is sorrowless.

original: gnod sems dang rjes su chags pa'i reg pa gnyis dang / bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa gsum ste /
analyzed: gnod sems dang rjes su chags pa'i reg pa gnyis dang / bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa gsum ste /
translated: The two contacts of malice and attachment and the three contacts of pleasure, etc.

original: de ltar de dag thams cad ni bcu drug tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar de dag thams cad ni bcu drug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, all of these are sixteen in number.

original: reg pa rnam par gtan la dbab pa dang rab tu dbye ba dang bcas te bshad zin to //üîΩtshor ba brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba la /üîΩtshor ba myong ba zhes sngar @311a * //
analyzed: reg pa rnam par gtan la dbab pa dang rab tu dbye ba dang bcas te bshad zin to // tshor ba brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba la / tshor ba myong ba zhes sngar @311a * //
translated: The determination and classification of contact have been explained.üîΩThe Explanation of Feeling

original: tshor ba bshad zin ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: tshor ba bshad zin ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Isn‚Äôt feeling already explained in the line ‚ÄúFeeling is the experience of contact‚Äù?

original: bshad pa bden mod kyi /
analyzed: bshad pa bden mod kyi /
translated: It is true that it is explained there.

original: der ni rang gi ngo bo'i sgo nas yin gyi rab tu dbye bas ni ma yin la /
analyzed: der ni rang gi ngo bo'i sgo nas yin gyi rab tu dbye bas ni ma yin la /
translated: However, it is explained there in terms of its own nature, but not in terms of its classification.

original: 'dir ni rab tu dbye ba'i sgo nas bstan pa brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir zlos pa'i skyon med de /
analyzed: 'dir ni rab tu dbye ba'i sgo nas bstan pa brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir zlos pa'i skyon med de /
translated: Here, it is explained in terms of its classification, and so there is no fault of repetition.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de las byung ba tshor ba drug ces smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de las byung ba tshor ba drug ces smos so //
translated: For that reason, it is said that the six feelings arise from those six contacts.

original: de dag kyang mdor bsdu na tshor ba gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag kyang mdor bsdu na tshor ba gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: Those six are also, in brief, two feelings:

original: lus kyi dang sems kyi'o //
analyzed: lus kyi dang sems kyi'o //
translated: the feeling of the body and the feeling of the mind.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that reason, it is said:

original: de dag las lnga ni lus kyi'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de dag las lnga ni lus kyi'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Five of them are bodily.

original: sems kyi yin yang dbang po gzugs can la brten pa'i phyir lus kyi zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems kyi yin yang dbang po gzugs can la brten pa'i phyir lus kyi zhes bya ste /
translated: Although they are mental, they are called bodily because they are based on material faculties.

original: rdul phra rab bsags pa yin pa'i phyir dang / lus la brten pa'i phyir na lus kyi sgra ni mig la sogs pa dag la 'jug go //
analyzed: rdul phra rab bsags pa yin pa'i phyir dang / lus la brten pa'i phyir na lus kyi sgra ni mig la sogs pa dag la 'jug go //
translated: The term ‚Äúbodily‚Äù is used for the eyes, etc., because they are collections of subtle particles and because they are based on the body.

original: sems tsam la brten pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems tsam la brten pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because they are based on the mind alone.

original: tsam zhes bya ba smos pa ni de las lhag pa'i rten gcad par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tsam zhes bya ba smos pa ni de las lhag pa'i rten gcad par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúalone‚Äù is used to exclude any other basis.

original: lus kyi yang sems la brten pa yin mod kyi ;
analyzed: lus kyi yang sems la brten pa yin mod kyi ;
translated: Although the body is also based on the mind,

original: sems tsam la brten pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sems tsam la brten pa ni ma yin te /
translated: it is not based on the mind alone,

original: de'i rten ni mig la sogs pa rnams kyang yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rten ni mig la sogs pa rnams kyang yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because its basis is also the eyes, etc.

original: yang ji ltar tshor ba reg pa'i 'og tu 'byung ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba bzhi ni gnyis ka ltar yang 'gal bar mthong ba'i dri ba'o //
analyzed: yang ji ltar tshor ba reg pa'i 'og tu 'byung ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba bzhi ni gnyis ka ltar yang 'gal bar mthong ba'i dri ba'o //
translated: The question is raised: ‚ÄúWhy is it that feeling is said to arise from contact, but the other aggregates are not?‚Äù The answer is:

original: bye brag tu smra ba smos pa ni kha cig na re skyed par byed pa'i chos las 'das pa ma rangs pa'i don du yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba smos pa ni kha cig na re skyed par byed pa'i chos las 'das pa ma rangs pa'i don du yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas are mentioned because some say that the past is a state of having gone beyond the state of being a cause.

original: phan tshun lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir tshor ba ni reg pa dang dus mnyam pa yin te /
analyzed: phan tshun lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir tshor ba ni reg pa dang dus mnyam pa yin te /
translated: Feeling is simultaneous with contact because they are mutual co-arising causes.

original: de las gzhan pa'i sems las byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i sems las byung ba bzhin no //
translated: This is not the case for other mental factors.

original: ji ltar lhan cig 'byung ba gnyis skyed par byed pa'ang bskyed par bya ba'i dngos por grub ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ji ltar lhan cig 'byung ba gnyis skyed par byed pa'ang bskyed par bya ba'i dngos por grub ces bya ba la /
translated: How can two simultaneous things be a cause and effect?

original: skyed par byed pa'i dngos po ni skyed par byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa'i dngos po ni skyed par byed pa nyid do //
translated: The state of being a cause is the state of being a producer.

original: 'bras bu skyed par nus pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu skyed par nus pa'o //
translated: It is the state of being able to generate an effect.

original: bskyed par bya ba'i dngos po ni bskyed par bya ba nyid de /
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba'i dngos po ni bskyed par bya ba nyid de /
translated: The state of being an object to be produced is the state of being produced.

original: bdag nyid du ma red pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag nyid du ma red pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is the state of not yet being generated.

original: de lta yin dang skyed par byed pa dang bskyed par bya ba'i dngos po ni skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dag la grub kyi skyes zin pa dag kho na la ni ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de lta yin dang skyed par byed pa dang bskyed par bya ba'i dngos po ni skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dag la grub kyi skyes zin pa dag kho na la ni ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: If that were so, the state of being producer and being produced would be established for what is arisen and what is not arisen, but not for what is just arisen.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba gnyis la yang skyed par byed pa dang bskyed par bya ba'i dngos po mi 'gal bar mthong ste 'dri bar ni ji ltar mi 'grub ces bya ba'o//
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba gnyis la yang skyed par byed pa dang bskyed par bya ba'i dngos po mi 'gal bar mthong ste 'dri bar ni ji ltar mi 'grub ces bya ba'o//
translated: And the state of being producer and being produced is seen to be non-contradictory in the case of two things that occur together.

original: @311b mthu med pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: @311b mthu med pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it is powerless.

original: skyes zin pa bdag nyid thob pa ni yang bskyed par mi nus te /
analyzed: skyes zin pa bdag nyid thob pa ni yang bskyed par mi nus te /
translated: What has already arisen, having attained its own nature, cannot be produced again.

original: skyes zin pa yang bskyed par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes zin pa yang bskyed par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because what has already arisen is not to be produced again.

original: de'i phyir de la de bskyed pa'i mthu yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la de bskyed pa'i mthu yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not that it has the power to produce that.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says,

original: chos skyes zin pa la ni chos kyi nus pa med do zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: chos skyes zin pa la ni chos kyi nus pa med do zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no power of a factor with regard to a factor that has already arisen.‚Äù

original: dam bcas pa dang bye brag med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni don gang zhig dam bcas pas nye bar bzung ba de nyid gtan tshigs kyi tshig gis kyang bzung bas dam bca' ba dang bye brag med do //
analyzed: dam bcas pa dang bye brag med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni don gang zhig dam bcas pas nye bar bzung ba de nyid gtan tshigs kyi tshig gis kyang bzung bas dam bca' ba dang bye brag med do //
translated: There is no difference between the thesis and the reason.

original: de nyid rab tu bstan pa'i phyir lhan cig 'byung ba gnyis zhes rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: de nyid rab tu bstan pa'i phyir lhan cig 'byung ba gnyis zhes rgyas par smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says, ‚Äúbecause they are two co-existent things,‚Äù etc.

original: phan tshun bsgrub bya sgrub byed yin pa'i phyir dam bca' ba dang khyad par med do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phan tshun bsgrub bya sgrub byed yin pa'i phyir dam bca' ba dang khyad par med do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: There is no difference between the thesis and the reason because they are mutually established.

original: gal te dam bca' ba dang bye brag med pa'i phyir 'di sgrub par byed pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te dam bca' ba dang bye brag med pa'i phyir 'di sgrub par byed pa ma yin na /
translated: If, because there is no difference between the thesis and the reason, this is not a proof,

original: 'o na ni phan tshun skyed par byed par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ni phan tshun skyed par byed par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: then it follows that they are mutually productive.

original: gang las 'dir gcig kho na skyed par byed pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i khyad par gyi rgyu ni 'ga' yang 'di la yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang las 'dir gcig kho na skyed par byed pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i khyad par gyi rgyu ni 'ga' yang 'di la yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Because there is no cause for distinguishing them here, one should say that ‚Äúonly this is productive, not the other.‚Äù

original: de lta yin dang reg pa dang tshor ba gnyis phan tshun skyed par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'gal lo //
analyzed: de lta yin dang reg pa dang tshor ba gnyis phan tshun skyed par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'gal lo //
translated: If that were so, then contact and feeling would be mutually generative, and that would contradict dependent origination.

original: de'i phyir lhan cig 'byung ba gnyis skyed par byed pa dang bskyed par bya ba'i dngos por mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir lhan cig 'byung ba gnyis skyed par byed pa dang bskyed par bya ba'i dngos por mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is illogical that two co-arisen states are a generator and generated.

original: 'dod pa'i phyir nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni grub pa la sgrub par ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i phyir nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni grub pa la sgrub par ston pa'o //
translated: The response ‚Äúbecause it is asserted‚Äù shows that this is an established proof.

original: 'dod pa 'di ni mdo las mi bzhed do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dod pa 'di ni mdo las mi bzhed do zhes bya ba la /
translated: The response ‚Äúthis assertion is not accepted in the s≈´tras‚Äù shows that this is not established.

original: chos mngon pa las /
analyzed: chos mngon pa las /
translated: The Abhidharma

original: lhan cig 'byung gang phan tshun 'bras //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung gang phan tshun 'bras //
translated: asserts that co-arisen states are mutually results.

original: zhes 'dod pa 'di mdo las ni mi bzhed de /
analyzed: zhes 'dod pa 'di mdo las ni mi bzhed de /
translated: This assertion is not accepted in the s≈´tras.

original: de bstan pa'i phyir mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: To demonstrate that, the s≈´tra says, ‚ÄúFeeling that arises from eye contact‚Äù and so on.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is illogical that co-arisen states are a generator and generated.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: skyed par byed pa'i chos dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa'i chos dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it contradicts the principle of generation.

original: skyed par byed pa dang bskyed par bya ba gnyis cig car ni mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: skyed par byed pa dang bskyed par bya ba gnyis cig car ni mi 'grub ste /
translated: The two, the producer and the produced, are not established simultaneously.

original: sa bon dang myu gu bzhin no //üîΩsnga phyi'i dngos po yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: sa bon dang myu gu bzhin no // snga phyi'i dngos po yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: They are like a seed and a sprout.üîΩNot only is there no simultaneity,

original: lhan cig pa'i dngos po yang grub pas ma nges so //
analyzed: lhan cig pa'i dngos po yang grub pas ma nges so //
translated: but there is also no establishment of a prior or subsequent state.

original: dper na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: For example,

original: mig dang gzugs la sogs pa dag ni lhan cig 'byung ba kho na mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnams kyi skyed par byed pa yin la /üîΩ'byung ba lhan @312a * //
analyzed: mig dang gzugs la sogs pa dag ni lhan cig 'byung ba kho na mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnams kyi skyed par byed pa yin la / 'byung ba lhan @312a * //
translated: the eye and form, etc. are only simultaneous with the eye consciousness, etc.

original: cig 'byung ba rnams kyang gzugs la sogs pa 'byung ba las gyur ba rnams kyi skyed par byed pa yin no //üîΩdgag pa ci zhig yod ces bya ba ni 'di la rigs pa yod pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: cig 'byung ba rnams kyang gzugs la sogs pa 'byung ba las gyur ba rnams kyi skyed par byed pa yin no // dgag pa ci zhig yod ces bya ba ni 'di la rigs pa yod pa ma yin zhing /
translated: The simultaneous primary elements are the producers of the derivative form, etc.üîΩWhat is the refutation?

original: de ni de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba'i lung yang med do //
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba'i lung yang med do //
translated: There is no reasoning here, nor is there a scripture that states, ‚ÄúIt is not so.‚Äù

original: 'o na ni myu gu dang grib ma dag dang / mar me dang 'od dag ji lta bar zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'o na ni myu gu dang grib ma dag dang / mar me dang 'od dag ji lta bar zhes bya ba la /
translated: But then, like the sprout and its shadow,üîΩand like the lamp and its light,

original: gal te skad cig ma dang po la grib ma med pa dang 'od med par 'gyur na ni de ltar snga phyi'i dngos por rtogs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te skad cig ma dang po la grib ma med pa dang 'od med par 'gyur na ni de ltar snga phyi'i dngos por rtogs par 'gyur na /

original: 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
translated: But that is not the case.

original: de'i phyir myu gu dang mar me ni grib ma dang 'od lhan cig 'byung ba dag gi rgyu yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
analyzed: de'i phyir myu gu dang mar me ni grib ma dang 'od lhan cig 'byung ba dag gi rgyu yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: Therefore, it is established that the sprout and the lamp are the causes of the shadow and the light, respectively.

original: 'dir yang rgyu'i tshogs pa sngar byung ba kho nar mar me 'od dang bcas pa dang myu gu grib ma dang bcas pa'i rgyur ci ste mi 'dod /
analyzed: 'dir yang rgyu'i tshogs pa sngar byung ba kho nar mar me 'od dang bcas pa dang myu gu grib ma dang bcas pa'i rgyur ci ste mi 'dod /
translated: Here, why not accept that the mere prior assembly of causes is the cause of the lamp and its light, and the cause of the sprout and its shadow?

original: gzhan yang 'gro ba dang gnas pa dang rnam par 'gyur ba'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir dang / yod pa dang med pa dag kyang de dag gi rgyu can yin pa'i phyir myu gu dang mar me dag grib ma dang 'od gnyis kyi skyed par byed pa yin la /üîΩ'od mar me'i yin pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'gro ba dang gnas pa dang rnam par 'gyur ba'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir dang / yod pa dang med pa dag kyang de dag gi rgyu can yin pa'i phyir myu gu dang mar me dag grib ma dang 'od gnyis kyi skyed par byed pa yin la / 'od mar me'i yin pa'am /
translated: Moreover, since the sprout and the flame are the causes of the shadow and the light, respectively, because they conform to the shadow and the light, and because the shadow and the light exist and do not exist in dependence on the sprout and the flame, respectively,üîΩit is not possible to establish that the light is of the flame

original: grib ma myu gu'i yin no zhes bya bar ni sgrub par mi nus pa yin no //
analyzed: grib ma myu gu'i yin no zhes bya bar ni sgrub par mi nus pa yin no //
translated: or that the shadow is of the sprout.

original: reg pa dang tshor ba dag lhan cig 'byung bar nges na ni /üîΩgang gis na reg pa'i rkyen kho nas tshor ba yin gyi /
analyzed: reg pa dang tshor ba dag lhan cig 'byung bar nges na ni / gang gis na reg pa'i rkyen kho nas tshor ba yin gyi /
translated: If contact and feeling definitely occur simultaneously,üîΩthen what is the reason for understanding that feeling is conditioned by contact

original: tshor ba'i rkyen gyis reg pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bar rtogs par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: tshor ba'i rkyen gyis reg pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bar rtogs par 'gyur ba /
translated: and that contact is not conditioned by feeling?

original: rgyu de 'dra ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu de 'dra ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no such cause.

original: de'i phyir mi mthun pa nye bar bkod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi mthun pa nye bar bkod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is an inappropriate example.üîΩOthers say: Feeling occurs after contact.

original: gzhan dag na re reg pa'i 'og tu tshor ba 'byung ste zhes zer ba ni slob dpon dpal len te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re reg pa'i 'og tu tshor ba 'byung ste zhes zer ba ni slob dpon dpal len te /
translated: This is the opinion of the master ≈örƒ´lƒÅta.

original: 'di ltar na 'dus pa ni dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin gyi lhan cig 'byung ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar na 'dus pa ni dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin gyi lhan cig 'byung ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Thus the assembly is the causal and resultant entity of the sense faculty, object, and consciousness, but it is not a coexistent cause.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag dus snga phyir 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag dus snga phyir 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because cause and effect arise in sequence.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag cig car ma yin pa'i phyir dbang po dang don gnyis ni de dag gi 'bras bur gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa bas snga la /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag cig car ma yin pa'i phyir dbang po dang don gnyis ni de dag gi 'bras bur gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa bas snga la /
translated: Since cause and effect do not occur simultaneously, the two, the sense faculty and object, precede the resultant consciousness.

original: de'i mjug thogs su skad cig ma gnyis pa la ni rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: de'i mjug thogs su skad cig ma gnyis pa la ni rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: Immediately after that, in the second moment, there is consciousness.

original: de dag gi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the result of those two.üîΩThe assembly of three is the cause of contact.

original: gsum 'dus pa de ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni der rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsum 'dus pa de ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni der rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the causal and resultant entities are complete there.

original: skad cig ma @312b gsum pa la zhes bya ba ni reg par gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis yin pa'i phyir skad cig ma gsum pa la tshor ba'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma @312b gsum pa la zhes bya ba ni reg par gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis yin pa'i phyir skad cig ma gsum pa la tshor ba'o //
translated: In the third moment, means in the third moment, because it is the condition of contact consciousness. Feeling is in the third moment.

original: de lta na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gal te skad cig ma gsum pa la tshor ba yin na /
analyzed: de lta na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gal te skad cig ma gsum pa la tshor ba yin na /
translated: If it is like this, etc. If feeling is in the third moment,

original: de lta na reg pa'i dus na tshor ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta na reg pa'i dus na tshor ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: then, because there is no feeling at the time of contact,

original: rnam par shes pa thams cad la tshor ba yod par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa thams cad la tshor ba yod par mi 'gyur te /
translated: feeling would not exist in all consciousnesses.

original: reg par gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa la tshor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: reg par gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa la tshor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no feeling in contact consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa thams cad reg pa yin par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni tshor ba'i dus na reg pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa thams cad reg pa yin par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni tshor ba'i dus na reg pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: All consciousness would not be contact, because there is no contact at the time of feeling.

original: 'dus pa'i 'og rol tshor ba'i dus na rnam par shes pa gang zhig skye ba de reg pa ma yin pas rnam par shes pa thams cad reg pa ma yin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'dus pa'i 'og rol tshor ba'i dus na rnam par shes pa gang zhig skye ba de reg pa ma yin pas rnam par shes pa thams cad reg pa ma yin par 'gyur na /
translated: The consciousness that arises at the time of feeling, after the assembly, is not contact. Therefore, all consciousness would not be contact.

original: 'di ni 'dod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni 'dod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But this is unacceptable.

original: reg pa dang tshor ba dag ni sa mang po pa yin pas sems can thams cad la 'byung ba'i phyir dang / rnam par shes pa thams cad reg pa yin no zhes khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: reg pa dang tshor ba dag ni sa mang po pa yin pas sems can thams cad la 'byung ba'i phyir dang / rnam par shes pa thams cad reg pa yin no zhes khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Contact and feeling are universal mental states, so they occur in all sentient beings, and it is accepted that all consciousness is contact.üîΩSince feeling that exists in subsequent contact arises from the cause of prior contact,

original: reg pa phyi ma la yod pa'i tshor ba reg pa snga ma'i rgyu las byung ba yin pas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni thams cad la tshor ba dang reg pa yod pa nyid du 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: reg pa phyi ma la yod pa'i tshor ba reg pa snga ma'i rgyu las byung ba yin pas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni thams cad la tshor ba dang reg pa yod pa nyid du 'dod pa yin no //
translated: this passage extensively explains that it is asserted that all have feeling and contact.

original: de ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i reg pa'i rkyen gyis yin pa nyid du mi 'dod do//
analyzed: de ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i reg pa'i rkyen gyis yin pa nyid du mi 'dod do//
translated: But it is not asserted that feeling arises from the condition of contact that occurs simultaneously with it.

original: 'o na de ga las yin zhe na /üîΩreg pa la snga ma'i rgyu las byung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: 'o na de ga las yin zhe na / reg pa la snga ma'i rgyu las byung ba yin gyi /
translated: If that is so, then from what does it arise?üîΩIt arises from the cause of prior contact.

original: dbang po dang yul snga ma'i rgyu mtshan can gyi reg pa gang yin pa de las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: dbang po dang yul snga ma'i rgyu mtshan can gyi reg pa gang yin pa de las byung ba yin no //
translated: It arises from the contact that has the prior sense faculty and object as its cause.

original: gang gi phyir de lta na dbang po dang don las byung ba'i rnam par shes pa'i reg pa yin pas reg pa thams cad tshor ba dang bcas pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta na dbang po dang don las byung ba'i rnam par shes pa'i reg pa yin pas reg pa thams cad tshor ba dang bcas pa yin la /
translated: Because in that case, all contact that arises from the sense faculty and object is contact that is accompanied by feeling.

original: shes pa thams cad kyang reg pa yin te /
analyzed: shes pa thams cad kyang reg pa yin te /
translated: And all consciousness is contact.

original: des na 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: des na 'gal ba med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no contradiction.

original: dmigs pa tha dad pa dag las zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang sgra la dmigs pa dag las so //
analyzed: dmigs pa tha dad pa dag las zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang sgra la dmigs pa dag las so //
translated: From those that have different objects means from those that have form and sound as their objects.

original: reg pa phyi ma la yod pa'i tshor ba zhes bya ba ni sgra la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: reg pa phyi ma la yod pa'i tshor ba zhes bya ba ni sgra la dmigs pa'o //
translated: The feeling that exists in the subsequent contact is the feeling that has sound as its object.

original: reg pa snga ma'i rgyu las byung ba yin no zhes bya ba ni gzugs la dmigs pa'i reg pa'i rgyu las byung ba'o //
analyzed: reg pa snga ma'i rgyu las byung ba yin no zhes bya ba ni gzugs la dmigs pa'i reg pa'i rgyu las byung ba'o //
translated: It arises from the cause of the prior contact means it arises from the cause of the contact that has form as its object.

original: ji ltar na zhes bya ba ni khro ba gsal bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar na zhes bya ba ni khro ba gsal bar byed pa ste /
translated: How is that?

original: reg pa dang tshor ba dag dmigs pa tha dad pa nyid yin na ni phyis byung ba'i tshor ba bde ba'i sgo nas reg pa snga ma nam yang bde ba myang bar mi 'gyur la /üîΩreg pa'i @313a * //
analyzed: reg pa dang tshor ba dag dmigs pa tha dad pa nyid yin na ni phyis byung ba'i tshor ba bde ba'i sgo nas reg pa snga ma nam yang bde ba myang bar mi 'gyur la /üîΩreg pa'i @313a * //
translated: If contact and feeling have different objects, then the subsequent feeling of pleasure does not experience the prior contact as pleasant.

original: stobs kyis dmigs pa nyams su myong ba yang yin pa'i phyir reg pa dang dmigs pa tha dad par mi rung ste /
analyzed: stobs kyis dmigs pa nyams su myong ba yang yin pa'i phyir reg pa dang dmigs pa tha dad par mi rung ste /
translated: It is not possible for contact and its object to be different, because the object is experienced by the power of contact.

original: 'di ltar bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pas sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar ji ltar byed /
analyzed: 'di ltar bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pas sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar ji ltar byed /
translated: Thus, how could contact that is to be experienced as pleasure cause the experience of pain?

original: yang na sems gang dang zhes bya ba'i sgra la dmigs pa dang ngo //
analyzed: yang na sems gang dang zhes bya ba'i sgra la dmigs pa dang ngo //
translated: Or, the term ‚Äúwith what mind‚Äù refers to the object.

original: de las dmigs pa gzhan pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs la dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de las dmigs pa gzhan pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs la dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúDifferent from that object‚Äù means different from the object of form.

original: de lta yin na nyes pa cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de lta yin na nyes pa cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the error if that is the case?

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i reg pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i nyes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i reg pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i nyes par 'gyur te /
translated: The error is that it would not be associated with the contact that occurs simultaneously with it,

original: dmigs pa tha dad pas mtshungs pa nyid lngas mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa tha dad pas mtshungs pa nyid lngas mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would not be associated with the five ways that things are the same, since the object is different.

original: sdug bsngal dang bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa la yang de dang 'dra bar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa la yang de dang 'dra bar brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said for that which is neither pleasure nor pain.

original: 'on ni de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa 'pho ba'i tshe ste /
analyzed: 'on ni de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa 'pho ba'i tshe ste /
translated: But if it is at that time, i.e., at the time of the object‚Äôs displacement,

original: mi 'pho na ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: mi 'pho na ni nyes pa med do //
translated: then there is no fault if there is no displacement.

original: ji ltar zhe na /üîΩgal te gzugs la dmigs pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa'i mjug thogs su mig gi rnam par shes pa'am /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na / gal te gzugs la dmigs pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa'i mjug thogs su mig gi rnam par shes pa'am /
translated: How is that?

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa gzugs la dmigs pa kho na 'byung na ni de tshor ba dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa gzugs la dmigs pa kho na 'byung na ni de tshor ba dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: If, immediately after a visual consciousness that has form as its object, a visual consciousness arises, or a mental consciousness arises that has form as its object, then it is accompanied by feeling.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sngar skyes pa mig gi rnam par shes pa yin pas rigs gcig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar skyes pa mig gi rnam par shes pa yin pas rigs gcig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
