original: de'i sngon rol gyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de'i sngon rol gyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Prior to that, a consciousness, etc.

original: ci'i phyir de reg pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de reg pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is that not contact?

original: 'di la rgyu smras pa ni rkyen ma tshang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di la rgyu smras pa ni rkyen ma tshang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The reason is stated: because the conditions are incomplete.

original: 'di ltar mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen thams cad kyis ni tshor ba'i rkyen gyis reg par gyur pa skyed par mi nus so //
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen thams cad kyis ni tshor ba'i rkyen gyis reg par gyur pa skyed par mi nus so //
translated: Thus, all the similar immediately antecedent conditions are unable to generate contact that is conditioned by feeling.

original: gzhan dag na re 'dir rkyen ma tshang pa ni dpang po 'pho ba dang / de las skyes pa'i yid la byed pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'dir rkyen ma tshang pa ni dpang po 'pho ba dang / de las skyes pa'i yid la byed pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: The condition is incomplete here because the witness is transferred and the attention born from that is transferred.üîΩWhat is wrong with that?

original: de lta yin na nyes pa ci zhig yod ces bya ba ni yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dmigs pa tha dad pa'i nyes pa med do snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de lta yin na nyes pa ci zhig yod ces bya ba ni yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dmigs pa tha dad pa'i nyes pa med do snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: He thinks: There is no fault of different objects because they do not exist.

original: sa mang po pa'i nges pa nyams pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sems thams cad la reg pa dang tshor ba dag med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sa mang po pa'i nges pa nyams pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sems thams cad la reg pa dang tshor ba dag med pa'i phyir te /
translated: The universal mental factors are impaired.

original: nyes pa 'dir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes pa 'dir 'gyur ro //
translated: This is the fault.

original: sa ni gsum ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sa ni gsum ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: There are three levels.

analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i sa ni 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang po'o //
translated: The level with investigation and analysis is the desire realm and the first absorption.

original: rtog pa med pa la dpyod pa tsam ni bsam gtan khyad par can no //üîΩrtog pa yang med dpyod pa yang med pa ni bsam gtan gnyis pa las /
analyzed: rtog pa med pa la dpyod pa tsam ni bsam gtan khyad par can no // rtog pa yang med dpyod pa yang med pa ni bsam gtan gnyis pa las /

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar ro //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar ro //
translated: The level without investigation and without analysis is the second absorption and so on up to the summit of existence.

original: dge ba'i sa ni chos @313b dge ba rnams te /
analyzed: dge ba'i sa ni chos @313b dge ba rnams te /
translated: The stage of virtue is the virtuous factors.

original: mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa yang de dang 'dra 'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa yang de dang 'dra 'o //
translated: The same applies to nonvirtue and the neutral.

original: slob pa'i sa ni slob pa'i zag pa med pa'i chos dag go //
analyzed: slob pa'i sa ni slob pa'i zag pa med pa'i chos dag go //
translated: The stage of training is the uncontaminated factors of those still training.

original: mi slob pa ni mi slob pa'i zag ba med pa'i chos dag go //
analyzed: mi slob pa ni mi slob pa'i zag ba med pa'i chos dag go //
translated: The stage of no more training is the uncontaminated factors of those no longer training.

original: slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos dag go //
analyzed: slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos dag go //
translated: The stage of neither training nor no more training is the contaminated factors.

original: 'dus ma byas ni ma bshad de /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni ma bshad de /
translated: The unconditioned is not mentioned,

original: sa rnams 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa rnams 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the stages are conditioned.

original: de la gang dag ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /üîΩde dag ni sa mang po pa la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de la gang dag ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la / de dag ni sa mang po pa la sogs pa la /
translated: As for the phrase ‚Äúthose that are called‚Ä¶‚Äù,üîΩthey are the factors that are called feeling, conception, volition,

original: tshor ba dang 'du shes sems pa dang zhes bya ba der ji skad du bshad pa rnams so //
analyzed: tshor ba dang 'du shes sems pa dang zhes bya ba der ji skad du bshad pa rnams so //
translated: and contact, as they are explained in the passage on the universal mental factors.

original: gzhan dag na re de dag ni zhes bya ba rgyas bar 'byung ba la /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re de dag ni zhes bya ba rgyas bar 'byung ba la /

analyzed: yang dang yang du rnam par rgyu ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause they move toward objects again and again‚Äù means that they cause the mind to engage its object again and again.

original: lus kyi tshor ba ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lus kyi tshor ba ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Why is bodily feeling not a mental activity?

original: 'di yid kho na la brten pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di yid kho na la brten pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not a mental activity because it is not based on the mind alone.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it based on?

original: mig la sogs pa dag la yang yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa dag la yang yin no //
translated: It is based on the eye and the other sense organs.

original: nye bar rgyu bar byed pa yang ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni yang dag par rtog par byed pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: nye bar rgyu bar byed pa yang ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni yang dag par rtog par byed pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: It is not a mental activity because it does not cause the mind to move toward an object.

original: rtog pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: rtog pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir la /
translated: because it is concomitant with nonconceptual consciousness.

original: yid bde ba la sogs pa rnams ni rnam par rtog pa'i phyir de'i dbang gis yid yul dag la yang dang yang du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid bde ba la sogs pa rnams ni rnam par rtog pa'i phyir de'i dbang gis yid yul dag la yang dang yang du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Mental satisfaction and so on are conceptual, and due to their power, the mind engages its objects again and again.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa'i bde ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa'i bde ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: The pleasure of the third absorption is mental feeling.

original: gal te yid tsam la brten pa'i tshor ba yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te yid tsam la brten pa'i tshor ba yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba yin na /
translated: If mental feeling is feeling that is supported by the mind alone,

original: 'o na ni des na bsam gtan gsum par btang snyoms kyi nye bar rgyu ba yang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'o na ni des na bsam gtan gsum par btang snyoms kyi nye bar rgyu ba yang brjod par bya ste /
translated: then in the third absorption equanimity would be mental feeling,

original: bsam gtan gsum pa'i bde ba yid kyi sa pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhe @315b na ;
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa'i bde ba yid kyi sa pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhe @315b na ;
translated: because the pleasure of the third absorption is a mental level.

original: de'i phyir dang po 'dod pa'i khams na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dang po 'dod pa'i khams na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore the root text states, ‚ÄúIn the first, pleasure is physical.‚Äù

original: dang po ni thog mar ro //
analyzed: dang po ni thog mar ro //
translated: The first is the beginning.

original: grag go zhes bya ba'i sgra ni la na de la snying po med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: grag go zhes bya ba'i sgra ni la na de la snying po med pa'i phyir te /
translated: The term ‚Äúit is said‚Äù is used because it is said that the first absorption has no essence.

original: gang gi phyir 'dod pa'i khams na yid kyis pa'i bde ba'i dbang po med pas ma bzhag pa de'i phyir khams gong ma na sems kyi bde ba'i dbang po yod kyang mi gzhag go zhes bya ba 'di la rgyu ci zhig yod /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dod pa'i khams na yid kyis pa'i bde ba'i dbang po med pas ma bzhag pa de'i phyir khams gong ma na sems kyi bde ba'i dbang po yod kyang mi gzhag go zhes bya ba 'di la rgyu ci zhig yod /
translated: Since the mental faculty's faculty of pleasure does not exist in the desire realm, it is not posited there. Therefore, though the mental faculty's faculty of pleasure exists in the higher realms, it is not posited there. What is the reason for this?

original: yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba ni gdon mi za bar gnyen po dang bcas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di la yang rigs ba ci zhig ste /
analyzed: yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba ni gdon mi za bar gnyen po dang bcas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di la yang rigs ba ci zhig ste /
translated: What is the logic that the mental faculty's pleasure is definitely concomitant with its antidote?

original: de lta na ni gnyen po med pa'i phyir btang snyoms kyang nye bar rgyu ba'i mtshan nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ni gnyen po med pa'i phyir btang snyoms kyang nye bar rgyu ba'i mtshan nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: If that were so, equanimity would not be defined as a near neutral state because it would not have an antidote.

original: gong na yid bde ba'i nye bar rgyu ba'i mtshan nyid ni gnyen po dang bcas pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: gong na yid bde ba'i nye bar rgyu ba'i mtshan nyid ni gnyen po dang bcas pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: The mental faculty's pleasure in the higher realms is not defined as having an antidote.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: nye bar rgyu bar byed pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: nye bar rgyu bar byed pa nyid yin no //
translated: It is defined as a near neutral state.

original: gzhan dag na re bsam gtan gsum pa'i bde ba ni brtan pa yin la nye bar rgyu ba ni mi ba rten pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re bsam gtan gsum pa'i bde ba ni brtan pa yin la nye bar rgyu ba ni mi ba rten pa yin no //
translated: Others say: The pleasure of the third absorption is stable and the mental faculty's pleasure is unstable.

original: de nyid kyi phyir yid kyi nye bar rgyu pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir yid kyi nye bar rgyu pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it is called a mental factor.

original: yid bde ba ni mi brtan pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: yid bde ba ni mi brtan pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Because mental satisfaction is unstable.

original: yid bde ba'i gnas lta bu zhes bya ba ni yid bde ba skyed par byed pa rnams so //
analyzed: yid bde ba'i gnas lta bu zhes bya ba ni yid bde ba skyed par byed pa rnams so //
translated: Or, they are called ‚Äúlike the basis of mental satisfaction‚Äù because they generate mental satisfaction.

original: de ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lngas mngon par bsgrub pa nyid la dgongs te gsungs par zad kyi zhes bya ba ni de dag gis drangs shing de dag gis bskyed pa nyid sems la bsams nas gsungs par zad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lngas mngon par bsgrub pa nyid la dgongs te gsungs par zad kyi zhes bya ba ni de dag gis drangs shing de dag gis bskyed pa nyid sems la bsams nas gsungs par zad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The statement that it is established by the five collections of consciousness is intended to refer to the fact that they are generated by the five collections of consciousness.

original: dper na mi sdug pa lta bu zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dper na mi sdug pa lta bu zhes bya ba la /
translated: For example, it is like the meditation on foulness.

original: mig gis gzugs dag mthong nas mi sdug pa'i rjes su lta zhing gnas so zhes gsungs pa de'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pas mngon par bsgrubs pa yin te /
analyzed: mig gis gzugs dag mthong nas mi sdug pa'i rjes su lta zhing gnas so zhes gsungs pa de'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pas mngon par bsgrubs pa yin te /
translated: The sutra states, ‚ÄúHaving seen forms with the eye, one dwells as one who observes the repulsiveness of the form.‚Äù Therefore, it is established by visual consciousness.

original: sngar rnam par bsngos pa la sogs pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar rnam par bsngos pa la sogs pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one previously sees a form that is already decomposed.

original: yid kyi sa pa yang yin te de'i mjug tu de 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid kyi sa pa yang yin te de'i mjug tu de 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is also on the mental faculty level because it occurs after that.

original: gzhan yang mthong nas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang mthong nas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Moreover, it is said that one sees and so on.

original: gal te 'di skad du mig gis yid bde ba'i gnas lta bu'i gzugs rnams nye bar rgyu'o zhes bya bar gsungs par gyur na ni de klan kar rung ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te 'di skad du mig gis yid bde ba'i gnas lta bu'i gzugs rnams nye bar rgyu'o zhes bya bar gsungs par gyur na ni de klan kar rung ba zhig na /
translated: If it were said that the eye approaches forms that are the basis for mental satisfaction, then that would be open to criticism.

original: 'on kyang mthong nas reg nas zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa'i phyir 'di ni klan kar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang mthong nas reg nas zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa'i phyir 'di ni klan kar mi rung ngo //
translated: But since it is said that one sees and so on up to one touches, this is not open to criticism.

original: ji ltar ma mthong bas na ma reg pa'i bar du nye bar rgyu zhe na /üîΩgzhan las mthong nas de'i brjod par @316a * //
analyzed: ji ltar ma mthong bas na ma reg pa'i bar du nye bar rgyu zhe na / gzhan las mthong nas de'i brjod par @316a * //
translated: How does one approach without seeing and so on up to without touching?

original: bya ba yid kyis nye bar rgyu ba yin no //
analyzed: bya ba yid kyis nye bar rgyu ba yin no //
translated: One sees in dependence on another and one approaches with the mental faculty that expresses that.

original: gzhan du na 'dod pa'i khams na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: gzhan du na 'dod pa'i khams na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Otherwise, in the desire realm, it would be said.

original: 'dod par gtogs pa'i mig la sogs pa dag gis ni gzugs su gtogs pa'i gzugs dang sgra dang reg bya dag mi 'dzin no //
analyzed: 'dod par gtogs pa'i mig la sogs pa dag gis ni gzugs su gtogs pa'i gzugs dang sgra dang reg bya dag mi 'dzin no //
translated: The eye and so on belonging to the desire realm does not apprehend form, sound and tactility belonging to the form realm.

original: gzugs kyi khams na 'dod pa'i khams la dmigs pa dag kyang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na 'dod pa'i khams la dmigs pa dag kyang zhes bya ba la /
translated: In the form realm, there is also observation of the desire realm.

original: gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa ni 'dod par gtogs pa'i dri dang ro dang reg bya dag snom pa'am myang ba'am reg pa mi byed de /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa ni 'dod par gtogs pa'i dri dang ro dang reg bya dag snom pa'am myang ba'am reg pa mi byed de /
translated: One born in the form realm does not smell, taste, or touch the smells, tastes, and tangible objects of the desire realm.

original: kham gyi zas kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kham gyi zas kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because one is free from attachment to the food of desire realm.

original: gzugs dag la lta la sgra yang nyan te /
analyzed: gzugs dag la lta la sgra yang nyan te /
translated: One sees form and hears sound.

original: zas ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zas ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is not food.

original: gal te ma mthong bar yang nye bar rgyu na /
analyzed: gal te ma mthong bar yang nye bar rgyu na /
translated: If one is attracted to something without seeing it,

original: 'o na mdo las mig gis gzugs dag mthong nas zhes ci'i phyir gsungs she na /
analyzed: 'o na mdo las mig gis gzugs dag mthong nas zhes ci'i phyir gsungs she na /
translated: why does a sutra state, ‚ÄúHaving seen forms with the eye‚Äù?

original: de'i phyir ji ltar ches gsal ba de ltar bshad ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar ches gsal ba de ltar bshad ces bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said, ‚ÄúIt is explained in the way that is most clear.‚Äù

original: mig la sogs pas mngon par bsgrubs pas ches sla bar bcad du rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pas mngon par bsgrubs pas ches sla bar bcad du rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is easier to understand that the eye and so on directly perceive their objects.

original: gang yang bud med kyi gzugs mthong nas de'i sgra la nye bar rgyu ba 'am /
analyzed: gang yang bud med kyi gzugs mthong nas de'i sgra la nye bar rgyu ba 'am /
translated: Also, having seen the form of a woman, one may be attracted to her voice.

original: bud med kyi sgra thos nas de'i gzugs la nye bar rgyu ba de yang yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: bud med kyi sgra thos nas de'i gzugs la nye bar rgyu ba de yang yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba kho na yin no //
translated: and when hearing the sound of a woman, he is attracted to her form.

original: dbang po dang don rnam par chad pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni mig gis gzugs dag mthong nas zhes bya ba dang / rna bas sgra rnams thos nas zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dbang po dang don rnam par chad pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni mig gis gzugs dag mthong nas zhes bya ba dang / rna bas sgra rnams thos nas zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa ste /
translated: In the sutra, the Buddha says that the eye sees visible form, the ear hears sound, etc.üîΩOtherwise, the sutra would say in a confused way: ‚ÄúHaving seen visible forms with the eye, one is attracted to sounds which are the basis of joy.‚ÄùüîΩThe mental faculty is attracted to the object-field of the mental faculty, i.e., the factors, by means of the mental faculty itself.

original: gzhan du na ni mig gis gzugs dag mthong nas yid bde ba'i gnas lta bu'i sgra rnams la nye bar rgyu'o zhes 'chol bar gsungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na ni mig gis gzugs dag mthong nas yid bde ba'i gnas lta bu'i sgra rnams la nye bar rgyu'o zhes 'chol bar gsungs par 'gyur ro //

original: dper na 'khor los sgyur ba'i bud med rin po che lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'khor los sgyur ba'i bud med rin po che lta bu'o //
translated: The mental faculty is attracted to the object-field of the mental faculty, i.e., the factors, by means of the mental faculty itself.

original: dmigs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la /üîΩci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: dmigs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la /üîΩci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: The mental faculty is

original: gzugs de nyid kha cig gi yid bde ba'i gnas lta bu yin la /
analyzed: gzugs de nyid kha cig gi yid bde ba'i gnas lta bu yin la /
translated: Because that form is the basis of mental satisfaction for some,

original: kha cig gi gzhan du yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha cig gi gzhan du yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but for others it is the basis of mental dissatisfaction.

original: du zhig ni 'dod ba'i khams dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: du zhig ni 'dod ba'i khams dang ldan pa yin /
translated: How many are associated with the desire realm?

original: de dag las kyang du zhig gi dmigs pa ni ci zhig yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag las kyang du zhig gi dmigs pa ni ci zhig yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: And what is the object of those?

original: du zhig 'dod pa la dmigs pa yin /üîΩdu zhig ni gzugs la dmigs pa yin /
analyzed: du zhig 'dod pa la dmigs pa yin / du zhig ni gzugs la dmigs pa yin /
translated: How many have desire as their object?üîΩHow many have form as their object?

original: du zhig ni @316b gzugs med pa la dmigs pa yin zhes bya ba 'o //
analyzed: du zhig ni @316b gzugs med pa la dmigs pa yin zhes bya ba 'o //
translated: How many have the formless realm as their object?üîΩSimilarly, up to those associated with the formless realm should be explained.

original: de bzhin du gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i bar du brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni du zhig ni gzugs kyi khams dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i bar du brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni du zhig ni gzugs kyi khams dang ldan pa yin /
translated: How many are associated with the form realm?

original: de dag las du zhig gi dmigs pa ni ci zhig yin /
analyzed: de dag las du zhig gi dmigs pa ni ci zhig yin /
translated: What is the object of those?

original: du zhig ni gzugs med pa'i khams dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: du zhig ni gzugs med pa'i khams dang ldan pa yin /
translated: How many are associated with the formless realm?

original: de dag las du zhig gi dmigs pa ni ci zhig yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dag las du zhig gi dmigs pa ni ci zhig yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What is the object of those?

original: je rnam par dpyad pa 'di la lus rnam par gzhag pa kho na zhig bya ste /
analyzed: je rnam par dpyad pa 'di la lus rnam par gzhag pa kho na zhig bya ste /
translated: In this analysis, only the establishment of the body should be done.

original: 'dod pa'i khams na ni yid bde ba la sogs pa gsum char dang / gzugs la sogs pa yul drug car yang yod do //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na ni yid bde ba la sogs pa gsum char dang / gzugs la sogs pa yul drug car yang yod do //
translated: In the desire realm, there are three: mental satisfaction and so on, and there are six objects such as form.

original: bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa dag na ni yid bde ba dang btang snyoms so //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa dag na ni yid bde ba dang btang snyoms so //
translated: In the first and second absorptions, there is mental satisfaction and equanimity.

original: de yan chad srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar na ni btang snyoms so //
analyzed: de yan chad srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar na ni btang snyoms so //
translated: Above that, up to the summit of existence, there is equanimity.

original: bsam gtan bzhi char na dri dang ro dag med do //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi char na dri dang ro dag med do //
translated: In all four absorptions, smell and taste do not exist.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni gzugs la sogs pa lnga char yang med do //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni gzugs la sogs pa lnga char yang med do //
translated: In the formless realm, the five such as form do not exist.

original: 'dod na thams cad rang dmigs can zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dod na thams cad rang dmigs can zhes bya ba la /
translated: All in the desire realm focus on their own realm.

original: 'dod pa na ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i yid nye bar rgyu ba bco brgyad po thams cad yod la /
analyzed: 'dod pa na ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i yid nye bar rgyu ba bco brgyad po thams cad yod la /
translated: In the desire realm, all eighteen mental applications of the desire realm exist.

original: gang dag la 'dod pa'i khams de nyid dmigs par yod pas na rang dmigs can no //
analyzed: gang dag la 'dod pa'i khams de nyid dmigs par yod pas na rang dmigs can no //
translated: Since they focus on the desire realm itself, they focus on their own realm.

original: spyod yul gzugs can bcu gnyis so //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: spyod yul gzugs can bcu gnyis so //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
translated: Twelve have form as their domain.

original: gzugs can gyi khams ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i yid nye bar rgyu ba bcu gnyis kyi spyod yul yin no //
analyzed: gzugs can gyi khams ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i yid nye bar rgyu ba bcu gnyis kyi spyod yul yin no //
translated: The form realm is the domain of the twelve mental applications that operate in the desire realm.

original: dri dang ro la nye bar rgyu ba drug ma gtogs te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dri dang ro la nye bar rgyu ba drug ma gtogs te zhes bya ba la /
translated: The formless realm is the object of the three mental applications of equanimity that operate in the higher realms.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de na de gnyis med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de na de gnyis med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because those two do not exist there.

original: gzugs kyi khams de na dri dang ro de gnyis med pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams de na dri dang ro de gnyis med pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because those two, smell and taste, do not exist in the form realm.

original: / gong ma gsum gyi zhes bya ba la khams gong ma gzugs med pa'i khams ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / btang snyoms chos la nye bar rgyu ba rnams kyi dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: / gong ma gsum gyi zhes bya ba la khams gong ma gzugs med pa'i khams ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / btang snyoms chos la nye bar rgyu ba rnams kyi dmigs pa yin te /
translated: The formless realm is the object of the three mental applications of pleasure, mental satisfaction, and equanimity that operate in the higher realms.

original: de la gzugs la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbsam gtan ni gnyis na bcu gnyis zhes bya ba ni yid mi bde ba'i nye bar rgyu ba drug med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la gzugs la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro // bsam gtan ni gnyis na bcu gnyis zhes bya ba ni yid mi bde ba'i nye bar rgyu ba drug med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: gzugs med pa na spyod pa ni nyon mongs pa can gcig kho na dang ldan no zhes bya bar thams cad la khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood for all.

original: srol 'dis zhes bya ba ni lugs sam tshul 'dis so //
analyzed: srol 'dis zhes bya ba ni lugs sam tshul 'dis so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy this method‚Äù means by this system or process.

original: lhag ma yang khong du chud par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lhag ma yang khong du chud par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The rest should be understood in the same way.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: bsam gtan dang por skyes pa bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa pa'i dge ba'i sems ma thob pa ni //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang por skyes pa bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa pa'i dge ba'i sems ma thob pa ni //
translated: One born in the first absorption who has not obtained the virtuous mind of the second absorption

original: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa thams cad dang ldan no //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa thams cad dang ldan no //
translated: possesses all the minds of the first absorption.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa pa ni nyon mongs pa can brgyad dang ldan no //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa pa ni nyon mongs pa can brgyad dang ldan no //
translated: One born in the second absorption possesses eight afflicted minds.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa dang bzhi pa'i sa pa ni nyon mongs pa can bzhi dang ldan no //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa dang bzhi pa'i sa pa ni nyon mongs pa can bzhi dang ldan no //
translated: One born in the third and fourth absorptions possesses four afflicted minds.

original: gzugs med pa na spyod pa ni nyon mongs pa can gcig kho na dang ldan no //üîΩbsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa pa'i dge ba'i sems nyer bsdogs kyis bsdus pa thob pa ni bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa thams cad dang ldan te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa na spyod pa ni nyon mongs pa can gcig kho na dang ldan no // bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa pa'i dge ba'i sems nyer bsdogs kyis bsdus pa thob pa ni bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa thams cad dang ldan te /
translated: One born in the formless realm possesses one afflicted mind.

original: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: One who obtains the virtuous mind of the second absorption subsumed by access concentration possesses all the minds of the first absorption because one is not free of attachment to the first absorption.

original: kha cig na re bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa pa ni bcu gnyis dang ldan te /
analyzed: kha cig na re bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa pa ni bcu gnyis dang ldan te /
translated: Some say: Those of the level of the second absorption possess twelve.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: dri dang ro la dmigs pa dag med pas yid bde ba dang btang snyoms kyi nye bar rgyu ba nyon mongs pa can brgyad dang / btang snyoms kyi nye bar rgyu pa bsam gtan gnyis pa'i nyer bsngogs kyis bsdus pa bzhi dang ldan no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dri dang ro la dmigs pa dag med pas yid bde ba dang btang snyoms kyi nye bar rgyu ba nyon mongs pa can brgyad dang / btang snyoms kyi nye bar rgyu pa bsam gtan gnyis pa'i nyer bsngogs kyis bsdus pa bzhi dang ldan no zhes zer ro //
translated: They possess eight afflicted mental applications of equanimity and four neutral mental applications of equanimity subsumed by access concentration to the second absorption because those focusing on smell and taste do not exist.

original: gzhan dag na re brgyad dang ldan te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re brgyad dang ldan te /
translated: Others say: They possess eight.

original: btang snyoms kyi nye bar rgyu ba bzhi po de dag ni btang snyoms kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / sa tha mi dad pa'i phyir tha dad par mi rtsi ste /
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi nye bar rgyu ba bzhi po de dag ni btang snyoms kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / sa tha mi dad pa'i phyir tha dad par mi rtsi ste /
translated: Those four neutral mental applications are not counted separately because they are the nature of equanimity and they are not different levels,

original: bsam gtan dang po'i nyer bsdogs bzhin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i nyer bsdogs bzhin no zhes zer ro //
translated: like the four access concentrations to the first absorption.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa dang bzhi pa'i sa pa'i nyon mongs pa can bzhi kho na dang ldan no //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa dang bzhi pa'i sa pa'i nyon mongs pa can bzhi kho na dang ldan no //
translated: They possess only the four afflicted mental applications of the third and fourth absorptions.

original: gzugs med pa na spyod pa ni nyon mongs pa can gcig kho na dang ldan no //
analyzed: gzugs med pa na spyod pa ni nyon mongs pa can gcig kho na dang ldan no //
translated: One possessing the formless realm is only one afflicted mind.

original: de ltar na tshul 'dis bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skyed pa yang khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na tshul 'dis bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skyed pa yang khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should understand that this method also applies to those born in the second absorption and so on.

original: gzhan dag na re zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos mdzad pa 'di nyid yin no //üîΩgang zhig gang las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /üîΩgang zag gi gzugs @319a * //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos mdzad pa 'di nyid yin no // gang zhig gang las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni / gang zag gi gzugs @319a * //
translated: Others say that this is the author of the treatise.üîΩIt is logical that those who are not free from attachment to form and so on

original: la sogs pa de las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i dmigs pa de la nye bar rgyu bar rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: la sogs pa de las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i dmigs pa de la nye bar rgyu bar rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: are not those who delight in form and so on.

original: de'i sa ba'i nyon mongs pa can spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i sa ba'i nyon mongs pa can spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they abandon afflicted states of that level.

original: ji ltar nye bar rgyu bar byed ce na /üîΩde la rjes su chags bar yang byed khong khro bar byed /
analyzed: ji ltar nye bar rgyu bar byed ce na / de la rjes su chags bar yang byed khong khro bar byed /
translated: How do they delight in them?üîΩThey delight in them, they are hostile to them and they are indifferent to them without analysis.

original: so sor ma brtags par btang snyoms su yang byed pa ste de'i phyir zag pa med pa rnams ma yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: so sor ma brtags par btang snyoms su yang byed pa ste de'i phyir zag pa med pa rnams ma yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Therefore, not only are they not uncontaminated,üîΩbut they are also not those who delight in form and so on.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:üîΩYou say that the twelve are the going of desire in the two meditative concentrations, and so on.

original: khyod kyis bsam gtan ni gnyis na bcu gnyis 'dod 'gro rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa'i zag pa dang bcas pa dag kyang thams cad ni ma yin no //
analyzed: khyod kyis bsam gtan ni gnyis na bcu gnyis 'dod 'gro rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa'i zag pa dang bcas pa dag kyang thams cad ni ma yin no //
translated: But not all contaminated states are so.

original: / 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: / 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: They are afflicted states.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i 'bras bu can rnams yin te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i 'bras bu can rnams yin te /
translated: They are the results of afflicted states.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang mthun pa rnams zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang mthun pa rnams zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They are compatible with affliction.

original: yid bde ba la sogs pa dag ni rnam pa gnyis te /üîΩyid yul rnams la rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba la sogs pa'i rjes su mthun pa dang rjes su mi mthun pa'o //
analyzed: yid bde ba la sogs pa dag ni rnam pa gnyis te / yid yul rnams la rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba la sogs pa'i rjes su mthun pa dang rjes su mi mthun pa'o //
translated: Mental satisfaction and so on are of two types:üîΩthey are compatible with attachment, anger and so on with regard to objects of the mental faculty, and they are not compatible with that.

original: de la gang dag rjes su chags ba la sogs pa dang mthun pa de dag ni nye bar rgyu ba zhes brjod kyi gzhan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la gang dag rjes su chags ba la sogs pa dang mthun pa de dag ni nye bar rgyu ba zhes brjod kyi gzhan ni ma yin te /
translated: Those that are compatible with attachment and so on are called engagement, but others are not.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de dag gis yid yul rnams la nye bar rgyu bar byed pa'o zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de dag gis yid yul rnams la nye bar rgyu bar byed pa'o zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: Therefore, they are called ‚Äúthose that move about in the sense objects‚Äù because they move about in the sense objects by way of the mind.

original: tshor ba'i dbang gis rjes su chags pa la sogs pa 'jug pa'i phyir de dag gis yul rnams la nye bar rgyu bar byed do zhes brjod do //
analyzed: tshor ba'i dbang gis rjes su chags pa la sogs pa 'jug pa'i phyir de dag gis yul rnams la nye bar rgyu bar byed do zhes brjod do //
translated: They are called ‚Äúthose that move about in the sense objects‚Äù because they engage in attachment and so on by the power of feeling.

original: so sor brtags pa'i btang snyoms ni dge ba yin pas de'i phyir so sor ma brtags par btang snyoms su byed pa ste zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: so sor brtags pa'i btang snyoms ni dge ba yin pas de'i phyir so sor ma brtags par btang snyoms su byed pa ste zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Since equanimity is virtuous, it is said, ‚ÄúThey are those that rest in equanimity without analysis.‚Äù

original: btang snyoms su byed kyi gtod par mi byed do zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: btang snyoms su byed kyi gtod par mi byed do zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
translated: They rest in equanimity, but they do not focus on the object.

original: gang gi gnyen por rtag tu yong pa drug gnas pa yin pa ste zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa gang dag gi gnyen por rtag tu yod pa gdon mi za bar bdog pa'i gnas pa ste rnal 'byor gyi khyad par yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi gnyen por rtag tu yong pa drug gnas pa yin pa ste zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa gang dag gi gnyen por rtag tu yod pa gdon mi za bar bdog pa'i gnas pa ste rnal 'byor gyi khyad par yin pa'o //
translated: They are the six that always exist, which are the antidote to those afflictions.

original: drug ba de dag kyang ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: drug ba de dag kyang ji ltar zhe na /
translated: What are the six?

original: mig gis gzugs rnams mthong nas yid bde bar yang mi 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mig gis gzugs rnams mthong nas yid bde bar yang mi 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He does not become happy-minded when he sees forms with the eye, and so on.

original: yid bde bar mi 'gyur te rjes su chags par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: yid bde bar mi 'gyur te rjes su chags par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: He does not become happy-minded, that is, he does not become attached.

original: yid mi bde bar mi 'gyur te khong khro bar mi 'gyur la btang snyoms su gnas te so sor brtags te gtod par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: yid mi bde bar mi 'gyur te khong khro bar mi 'gyur la btang snyoms su gnas te so sor brtags te gtod par mi byed pa'o //
translated: He does not become unhappy-minded, that is, he does not become angry. He remains equanimous, and he does not become engaged through careful consideration.

original: dran pa dang / @319b ldan zhing shes bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dran pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab kyi gnyen por tshol lo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dran pa dang / @319b ldan zhing shes bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dran pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab kyi gnyen por tshol lo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: He is endowed with mindfulness and has introspection, that is, he seeks the antidote with wisdom that is concomitant with mindfulness. This is the meaning of the passage.

original: gal te mig gis gzugs rnams mthong nas yid bde bar mi 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te mig gis gzugs rnams mthong nas yid bde bar mi 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: If he does not become happy-minded when he sees forms with the eye, and so on,

original: 'o na dgra bcom pa yid bde bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na //
analyzed: 'o na dgra bcom pa yid bde bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na //
translated: then an arhat would not become happy-minded.

original: de'i phyir dgra bcom pa la yang 'jig rten pa'i dge ba chos la dmigs pas yid bde ba med pa ma yin pas zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir dgra bcom pa la yang 'jig rten pa'i dge ba chos la dmigs pas yid bde ba med pa ma yin pas zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore it says, But it is not that an arhat does not have happiness of mind that is virtuous and mundane, because it has a mundane object.

original: de dgag pa yin par mngon no zhes bya ba la de ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: de dgag pa yin par mngon no zhes bya ba la de ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: It is clear that this is a negation.

original: dgag pa gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: dgag pa gang zhig ce na /
translated: What is the negation?

original: mig gzugs rnams mthong nas yid bde bar mi 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mig gzugs rnams mthong nas yid bde bar mi 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //

original: chos la dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni chos nyan pa la sogs pa dag gi cho sangs rgyas kyi yon tan rnams mngon du bde ba'i yid bde ba dang ldan pa ni yid nye bar rgyu ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //

translated: The phrase ‚Äúhaving the Dharma as its object‚Äù means that the mental attention of those who listen to the Dharma, etc. is not distracted by the pleasant feelings that arise from the qualities of the Buddha.

original: ston pa'i bka' sum cu rtsa drug ces bya ba ni ston pa'i mtshan nyid dang ston pa'i rtags te /
analyzed: ston pa'i bka' sum cu rtsa drug ces bya ba ni ston pa'i mtshan nyid dang ston pa'i rtags te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe thirty-six statements of the Teacher‚Äù refers to the characteristics of the Teacher and the signs of the Teacher.

original: 'di dag gis ston pa go bar byed ces bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: 'di dag gis ston pa go bar byed ces bya ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning of the statement is that these are the means by which the Teacher is recognized.

original: gzhan la de dag rnam par 'byed pa'i nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan la de dag rnam par 'byed pa'i nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because no one else has the ability to distinguish them.

original: zhen pa la brten pa dang nges par 'byung ba nyid la brten pa'i bye brag gis zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhen pa la brten pa dang nges par 'byung ba nyid la brten pa'i bye brag gis zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe distinction between that which is based on attachment and that which is based on the attainment of liberation‚Äù means that the former is based on the mundane path and the latter is based on the supramundane path.

analyzed: zhen pa ni brkam pa ste don du gnyen ba dang chags ba dang / mngon bar zhen pa dang / sred pa zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs dag go //

original: nges par 'byung ba nyid ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba nyid ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
translated: The nature of renunciation is freedom from attachment.

analyzed: 'khor ba 'am kun nas nyon mongs pa las nges par 'byung ba ni nges par 'byung ba nyid do //

analyzed: 'di skad du mdo las mig gis shes par bya ba'i gzugs dag la brten nas yid bde ba skye bar 'gyur zhing /

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /

analyzed: sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya dang chos dag la yang de bzhin du rig par bya la /

analyzed: yid mi bde ba dang btang snyoms kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Mental pleasure, mental pain, and equanimity are also like that.üîΩThus, the member of existence called ‚Äúfeeling‚Äù is the six feelings that arise from that. analyzed: bar du rgyas par 'byung ba'o //

analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang las kyi gzhi rnams so zhes brtan pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs gsum dang las gnyis so //
translated: The karmas are the four karmas.üîΩThe bases are the seven bases.üîΩThe afflictions are the three roots of unwholesomeness.üîΩThe karmas are the four karmas.

analyzed: gzhi bdun zhes bya bar ro //

original: zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: The afflictions are like seeds.

original: nyon mongs pa'i klu gnas pa'i skye ba'i mtsho yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i klu gnas pa'i skye ba'i mtsho yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The lake of birth in which the nƒÅgas of the afflictions dwell is also like that.

original: nyon mongs pa yod na las rnams nye bar sogs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa yod na las rnams nye bar sogs par 'gyur la /

analyzed: des na nge las skyes pa yin pas nyon mongs pa yod na 'ga' zhig gi yang skye ba'i mtsho skams par mi 'gyur ro //

analyzed: las rnams kyang rnam par smin pa skye bar bya ba la de bzhin du rig par bya ba'o //

original: zhes bya ba ni nye ba'i rgyur te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nye ba'i rgyur te /

original: nyon mongs pa rnams ni ring ba yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams ni ring ba yin no //

original: thar par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa la yang yang srid pa'i rgyu yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thar par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa la yang yang srid pa'i rgyu yod pa'i phyir ro //

original: de dag ni bshad zin to zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag ni bshad zin to zhes bya ba la /

original: ji ltar zhe na /üîΩ'dir gang 'chi dang skye ba yi //

analyzed: srid pa'i bar du 'byung ba'o //

analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / skye ba'i srid pa ni 'gro ba dag tu nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig go zhes bya ba dang / de phan chad 'chi ba'i skad cig ma gtogs pa gzhan ni dus snga ma'i srid pa'o //

analyzed: gang gi 'og tu srid pa bar ma 'byung ba tha ma'i skad cig ma ni 'chi ba'i srid pa'o //

original: skye ba'i srid pa nyon mongs can /
analyzed: skye ba'i srid pa nyon mongs can /

analyzed: // / zhes bya ba ni dge ba ma yin zhing ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ma yin pa ste /

analyzed: de'i phyir gcig tu zhes bya ba smos te /

analyzed: / nyon mongs pa dmigs kyis ma byed pas dri ba 'di nyon mongs pa gang gi zhes bya ba ste /

analyzed: de'i phyir nyon mongs kun zhes bya ba smos so //

analyzed: ci skye ba'i srid pa thams cad nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur ram zhe nam yin no //

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /

original: @320b rang gis pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kho na ste /
analyzed: @320b rang gis pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kho na ste /

analyzed: 'dod chags dang / khor khro dang / nga rgyal dang / gti mug dang / lta ba dang / the tshom zhes bya ba dag gis so //

analyzed: kun nas dkris pa chig rkya thub pa rnams kyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la /

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pas ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa dang / rmugs pa dang / rgod pa dang / gnyid ces bya ba kun nas dkris pa rang dbang ba ma yin pa yod pas de'i phyir chig rkya thub pa rnams kyis zhes khyad par du byas so //

translated: Shamelessness, nonembarrassment, lethargy, excitation, and sleep are not autonomous since they are concomitant with afflictions such as attachment. Therefore they are distinguished as not autonomous.

analyzed: ma rig pa las gzhan nyon mongs pa 'dod chags la sogs pa dang mtshungs par mi ldan pas na chig rkya thub pa dag ces bya ste /

original: nyon mongs pa rnams kyis nying mtshams sbyor ro zhes 'byung ba dang / de'i tshe dri za la sems gnyis las gang yang rung ba zhig mngon du 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams kyis nying mtshams sbyor ro zhes 'byung ba dang / de'i tshe dri za la sems gnyis las gang yang rung ba zhig mngon du 'gyur te /

original: rjes su chags pa dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: rjes su chags pa dang ldan pa'am /

analyzed: khong khro ba dang ldan pa'o zhes gsungs pa dang / rang dbang ba rnams ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i phyir de dag gi nyid mtshams sbyor ba dgag go //

analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pas rang dbang ma yin pa rnams kyis ni nyid mtshams sbyor ba mi dgag go //

original: gal te gnas skabs de ni zhen pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te gnas skabs de ni zhen pa ma yin nam /
translated: If that state is not one of attachment,

original: ji ltar der log par lta ba la sogs pa dag kun du 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar der log par lta ba la sogs pa dag kun du 'byung zhe na /
translated: how can wrong views and so on occur there?üîΩTherefore, it is said:

analyzed: de'i phyir / gnas skabs de zhan pa yin mod kyi zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /

analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams mi g-yer ba'i phyir gnas skabs de na zhen pa yin zhes bya'o //

analyzed: gzhan dag na re de na tshor ba btang snyoms kho na yod pas de'i phyir zhan pa zhes brjod do zhes zer ro //

original: gang zhig gis gang la yang dang yang du zhes bya ba ni rtag tu zhugs zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang zhig gis gang la yang dang yang du zhes bya ba ni rtag tu zhugs zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That which is repeatedly cultivated is the meaning of ‚Äúcontinually engaged.‚Äù

analyzed: nye bar zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba dang nye bar te / spyad pa @321a * //

analyzed: phra ba ni srid pa bar ma ba rnams kyi yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //

analyzed: yang ci 'di rnams thams cad @321b khams thams cad na yod dam zhe na / de'i phyir / kham gyi zas ni 'dod pa na //

analyzed: kham gyi zas ni 'dod pa kho na na yod pa yin te / kham gyi zas kho na ni ma yin te /

analyzed: kham gyi zas kyi 'dod chags dang ma bral ba gzugs dang gzugs med par mi skye ba'i phyir ro //

original: de nyid kyi phyir der skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir der skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /

analyzed: de yang skye mched gsum gyi bdag nyid do zhes bya ba ni skye mched gsum gyi ngo bos te /

analyzed: dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i skye mched kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: kham du byas te mid pa'i phyir kham gyi zas kho na yin no zhes bya ba la /

translated: Though odors, tastes and tactile objects of the desire realm are drawn in by the mouth for the most part after being cut into morsels, subtle morsels of oral food are not excluded from being food since they are of that type, like bathing and massaging the body.üîΩIt is not the form base because it does not benefit its own sense faculty and it does not benefit the liberated being.

original: gzugs kyi skye mched kyis rang gi dbang po la mi phan pa'i phyir dang / grol ba la mi phan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye mched kyis rang gi dbang po la mi phan pa'i phyir dang / grol ba la mi phan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The form base is not food because it is not swallowed,

original: gzugs kyi skye mched ni mid pa'i tshe zhes bya ba ni mid pa'i dus na ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye mched ni mid pa'i tshe zhes bya ba ni mid pa'i dus na ste /
translated: but it is swallowed when it is eaten.

original: zas kyis gang gi tshe khar bcug pa dang / sos mnal ba dang / mchil mas brlan pa dang / mid pa las 'das par gyur pa de'i tshe sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi dbang @322a * //

translated: When food is placed in the mouth, chewed by the teeth, moistened by saliva, and swallowed, it passes beyond the nose, tongue, and body sense faculties.üîΩ

original: po dag gam /
analyzed: po dag gam /
translated: When food is placed in the mouth, chewed, moistened with saliva, and swallowed, then the nose, tongue, and body faculties orüîΩtheir objects, odors, tastes, and tangibles,üîΩbenefit the great elements that are their supports.

original: de dag gis dri la sogs pa rnams 'dzin pas de'i rten 'byung ba chen po rnams la phan 'dogs pa de bzhin du gzugs kyi skye mched ni mid pa'i tshe ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis dri la sogs pa rnams 'dzin pas de'i rten 'byung ba chen po rnams la phan 'dogs pa de bzhin du gzugs kyi skye mched ni mid pa'i tshe ma yin no //
translated: But the form base is not benefited when it is swallowed.

original: gzugs kyi skye mched ni rang gi dbang po ste /üîΩmig gi dbang po gang yin pa'am /
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye mched ni rang gi dbang po ste / mig gi dbang po gang yin pa'am /
translated: The form base is the eye faculty,üîΩor the great elements that are the basis of the eye faculty, the great elements that are its support.

original: de'i 'byung ba chen po ste dbang po'i rten 'byung ba chen po gang dag yin pa de la phan mi 'dogs na dbang po gzhan rna ba la sogs pa dag la phan 'dogs pa lta smos kyang ci dgos //
analyzed: de'i 'byung ba chen po ste dbang po'i rten 'byung ba chen po gang dag yin pa de la phan mi 'dogs na dbang po gzhan rna ba la sogs pa dag la phan 'dogs pa lta smos kyang ci dgos //
translated: If it does not benefit the great elements that are its support, then how much less does it benefit the other faculties, such as the ear?

original: yul ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rna ba la sogs pa dag gi yul ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: yul ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rna ba la sogs pa dag gi yul ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Because it is not an object means that it is not an object of the ear, etc.

original: gal te mid pa'i tshe gzugs kyi skye mched mig gis ma bzung bas mig gi dbang po la phan mi 'dogs na /
analyzed: gal te mid pa'i tshe gzugs kyi skye mched mig gis ma bzung bas mig gi dbang po la phan mi 'dogs na /
translated: If, when swallowed, the form base does not benefit the eye faculty because it is not apprehended by the eye,

original: 'o na zas kyi tshe mthong ba na phan 'dogs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na zas kyi tshe mthong ba na phan 'dogs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then it would benefit the eye when it is seen, when it is food.

original: de'i phyir gang gi tshe mthong ba na zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gi tshe mthong ba na zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: Therefore he says, When it is seen, etc.

original: de la dmigs pa ni mthong bzhin pa'i gzugs la dmigs pa'o //üîΩyang de'i tshe yang de la dmigs pa bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa zas yin gyi /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa ni mthong bzhin pa'i gzugs la dmigs pa'o // yang de'i tshe yang de la dmigs pa bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa zas yin gyi /
translated: That which focuses on it is that which focuses on the form that is being seen.üîΩBut how do you understand that at that time, contact that focuses on it is food that produces pleasant experience,

original: gzugs ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar rtogs she na /üîΩde'i phyir grol ba phyir mi 'ong pa dang dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: gzugs ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar rtogs she na / de'i phyir grol ba phyir mi 'ong pa dang dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: but form is not?üîΩTherefore he says, The liberated nonreturners and arhats, etc.

original: phyir mi 'ong pa smos pa ni de dag kyang 'dod pa pas 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong pa smos pa ni de dag kyang 'dod pa pas 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The term nonreturner is mentioned because they are free from attachment to the desire realm.

original: mthong ba'i gzugs zas kyi bya ba byed pa la ji ltar dri dang / ro dang / reg bya mid bzhin pa dag bzhin du phyir mi 'ong ba rnams dang dgra bcom pa rnams la yang byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i gzugs zas kyi bya ba byed pa la ji ltar dri dang / ro dang / reg bya mid bzhin pa dag bzhin du phyir mi 'ong ba rnams dang dgra bcom pa rnams la yang byed par 'gyur te /
translated: Just as smell, taste and tactility that are not swallowed perform the function of food, so too they perform the function of food for nonreturners and arhats.

original: 'di skad du kham gyi zas ni lag na yod pa'am snod na yod pas zas kyi bya ba mi byed kyi /
analyzed: 'di skad du kham gyi zas ni lag na yod pa'am snod na yod pas zas kyi bya ba mi byed kyi /
translated: This is stated because food in the mouth or in a vessel does not perform the function of food.

original: 'on kyang gang gi tshe khar bcug pa dang / sos mnal ba dang / mchil mas brlan pa dang / ming par 'das pa dang / pho ba khengs par gyur pa zhes bya ba rgyas par yin pa de'i tshe zas nyid kyi ched du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'on kyang gang gi tshe khar bcug pa dang / sos mnal ba dang / mchil mas brlan pa dang / ming par 'das pa dang / pho ba khengs par gyur pa zhes bya ba rgyas par yin pa de'i tshe zas nyid kyi ched du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i phyir te /
translated: However, when it is placed in the mouth, chewed by the teeth, moistened by saliva, swallowed and fills the stomach, it becomes food.

original: zas kyi dngos po byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zas kyi dngos po byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the statement, ‚ÄúIt performs the function of food.‚Äù

original: de'i gong bu mtha' dag lag pa la sogs pa na yod pa na 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i ming gis kham gyi zas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i gong bu mtha' dag lag pa la sogs pa na yod pa na 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i ming gis kham gyi zas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: When the entire mass of food is in the hand and so on, it is called ‚Äúfood in the mouth‚Äù by the name of its future state.

original: gzhan ni gzugs kyi skye mched ni zas ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan ni gzugs kyi skye mched ni zas ma yin te /
translated: The other sense bases are not food,

original: phrad @322b nas 'dzin pa'i dbang pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir sgra bzhin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: phrad @322b nas 'dzin pa'i dbang pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir sgra bzhin no zhes zer ro //
translated: because they are not objects that are grasped by the sense faculties that apprehend by contact, like sound.

original: reg dang sems pa rnam shes ni //üîΩzag bcas zas yin gsum dag na //
analyzed: reg dang sems pa rnam shes ni // zag bcas zas yin gsum dag na //
translated: Contact, intention, and consciousnessüîΩare contaminated food.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: The three are food.

original: kham gyi zas skye mched gsum gyi bdag nyid can ni gcig tu zag pa dang bcas pa yin pas gsum po kho na zag pa dang bcas pas khyad par du byas so //
analyzed: kham gyi zas skye mched gsum gyi bdag nyid can ni gcig tu zag pa dang bcas pa yin pas gsum po kho na zag pa dang bcas pas khyad par du byas so //
translated: The three sense bases that are food by mouthfuls are exclusively contaminated, so they are distinguished as contaminated.

original: srid pa gso bar byed pa'i don ni zas kyi don yin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: srid pa gso bar byed pa'i don ni zas kyi don yin zhes bya ba la /
translated: The meaning of food is the meaning of nourishing existence.

original: ji ltar na de dag srid pa gso bar byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na de dag srid pa gso bar byed ce na /
translated: How do they nourish existence?

original: ma 'phangs pa 'phen pa'i phyir dang / 'phangs pa mngon par 'grub par byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ma 'phangs pa 'phen pa'i phyir dang / 'phangs pa mngon par 'grub par byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they project what has not been projected and actualize what has been projected,

original: srid pa rjes su mi gcod pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: srid pa rjes su mi gcod pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: because they are the cause of not interrupting existence.

original: reg pa dang / sems pa dang / rnam par shes pa zag pa med pa de dag ni srid pa zad par bya ba'i phyir skyes pa dag yin te /
analyzed: reg pa dang / sems pa dang / rnam par shes pa zag pa med pa de dag ni srid pa zad par bya ba'i phyir skyes pa dag yin te /
translated: Contact, intention, and consciousness that are uncontaminated are born in order to exhaust existence.

original: srid pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the antidote to existence.

original: gal te yang skyes zin pa'i srid pa rgyas par byed mod kyi srid pa gzhan skyed par byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te yang skyes zin pa'i srid pa rgyas par byed mod kyi srid pa gzhan skyed par byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Even though they increase the existence that has already arisen, they do not generate another existence.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de dag zag pa dang bcas pa yin yang khams dang sa skal ba mi mnyam pa dag ni zas ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de dag zag pa dang bcas pa yin yang khams dang sa skal ba mi mnyam pa dag ni zas ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, even though they are contaminated, they are not food in the realms and stages that are not homogeneous.

original: skal ba mi mnyam pa'i sa na ni rgyas pa'i rgyu nyid yin na yang phyi ma la srid pa de sbrel ba'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir zas ma yin no //
analyzed: skal ba mi mnyam pa'i sa na ni rgyas pa'i rgyu nyid yin na yang phyi ma la srid pa de sbrel ba'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir zas ma yin no //
translated: Even though they are the cause of increase in other homogeneous stages, they are not food because they are not the cause of connecting with that existence in the future.üîΩMoreover, a sutra states:

original: gzhan yang mdo las zas bzhi po 'di dag ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang mdo las zas bzhi po 'di dag ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: These four foods are for the maintenance,üîΩendurance, support, and pleasure of beings that exist and for the benefit of those seeking rebirth.

original: de la gnas pa ni mi 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: de la gnas pa ni mi 'chad pa'o //
translated: Maintenance is non-disruption.

original: 'tsho ba ni rgyun chags su rjes su 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'tsho ba ni rgyun chags su rjes su 'jug pa'o //
translated: Endurance is continuous engagement.

original: yang na ni snga ma'i bshad pa phyi ma yin no //
analyzed: yang na ni snga ma'i bshad pa phyi ma yin no //
translated: Or else, the latter explanation is for the former.

original: phan par byed pa ni yang srid pa mngon par 'grub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: phan par byed pa ni yang srid pa mngon par 'grub par byed pa'o //
translated: That which is beneficial is that which brings about the manifestation of a new existence.

original: zag pa med pa'i chos rnams ni de lta ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni rgyun mi 'chad pa'am yang srid pa mngon par 'grub pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos rnams ni de lta ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni rgyun mi 'chad pa'am yang srid pa mngon par 'grub pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: But this is not so for the uncontaminated dharmas, because they are not continuous or the manifestation of a new existence.

original: de'i phyir reg pa la sogs pa rnams ni zag pa dang bcas pa kho na zas yin gyi zag pa med pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bar mdo las khong du chud do //
analyzed: de'i phyir reg pa la sogs pa rnams ni zag pa dang bcas pa kho na zas yin gyi zag pa med pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bar mdo las khong du chud do //
translated: Therefore, we understand from the sutra that only those with-outflows are nutriments, not the uncontaminated dharmas.

original: re zhig byung ba ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: re zhig byung ba ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: First, as for that which has already arisen,

original: byung ba ni skyes pa dang mngon par grub pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byung ba ni skyes pa dang mngon par grub pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: arisen means produced and manifested.

original: yid las skyes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni yid tsam las skyes pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yid las skyes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni yid tsam las skyes pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it arises from the mind alone,

original: de ltar na yid kho na smos @323a * //
analyzed: de ltar na yid kho na smos @323a * //
translated: thus, only the mind is mentioned,

original: pa 'bras bu dang bcas par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: pa 'bras bu dang bcas par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: together with its result, but not the others.

original: 'di nyid bstan pa'i phyir phyi'i khu chu dang khrag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di nyid bstan pa'i phyir phyi'i khu chu dang khrag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says, ‚Äúthe external semen and blood, etc.‚Äù

original: sogs ba zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gcin dang phyis dang 'dam rdzab la sogs pa rnams bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs ba zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gcin dang phyis dang 'dam rdzab la sogs pa rnams bsdu'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes urine, feces, mud, etc.

original: dri za ba'i phyir na zhes bya ba ni dri za ba dang dri zas su za ba'i phyir na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dri za ba'i phyir na zhes bya ba ni dri za ba dang dri zas su za ba'i phyir na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause they eat odors‚Äù means that they eat odors and they eat odors for food.

original: srid pa tshol ba'i dang tshul can yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: srid pa tshol ba'i dang tshul can yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause they have the nature of seeking existence‚Äù means that

original: ma skyes pas phal cher skye ba la gzhol ba ni srid pa tshol ba'i ngang tshul can no //
analyzed: ma skyes pas phal cher skye ba la gzhol ba ni srid pa tshol ba'i ngang tshul can no //
translated: they have the nature of seeking birth, since they are not born but are mostly directed toward birth.

original: skye pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: skye pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause they are directed toward birth‚Äù means that

original: de'i don du mngon par grub pa'i phyir dang / de ma thag tu skye ba'i phyir na skye po la mngon du phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i don du mngon par grub pa'i phyir dang / de ma thag tu skye ba'i phyir na skye po la mngon du phyogs pa'o //
translated: they are directed toward birth because they are formed for that purpose and because they are born immediately after.

original: mdo las gnod pa dang bcas pa'i lus mngon par grub nas zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: mdo las gnod pa dang bcas pa'i lus mngon par grub nas zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: The sutra says, ‚Äúhaving formed a body that is subject to injury.‚Äù

original: srid pa bar ma mngon par 'grub pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: srid pa bar ma mngon par 'grub pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The intermediate existence is established.

original: khungs ni gnod pa dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten du skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di yin te /
analyzed: khungs ni gnod pa dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten du skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di yin te /
translated: The source is the statement, ‚ÄúOne is born in a world that has been destroyed.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir sngar mngon par grub nas gnod pa dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten du skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sngar mngon par grub nas gnod pa dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten du skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one is born in a world that has been destroyed and then is destroyed again,

original: mu bzhi gsungs pa'i phyir ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: mu bzhi gsungs pa'i phyir ci yin zhe na /
translated: because the four possibilities are stated.

original: srid pa bar ma mngon par grub par brjod do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: srid pa bar ma mngon par grub par brjod do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The intermediate existence is established.

original: mu dang po ni phyir mi 'ong pa khams gnyis las 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: mu dang po ni phyir mi 'ong pa khams gnyis las 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
translated: The first possibility is the nonreturner who is free from attachment to the two realms.

original: gnyis pa ni bar ma dor yongs su myang na las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni bar ma dor yongs su myang na las 'das pa'o //
translated: The second is the one who attains nirvana in the intermediate state.

original: gsum pa ni dgra bcom pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni dgra bcom pa'o //
translated: The third is the arhat.

original: bzhi pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang phyir mi 'ong ba gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba dang ; / bdag cag la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang phyir mi 'ong ba gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba dang ; / bdag cag la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The fourth is the stream enterer, the once returner, the nonreturner who goes to the form realm, and ourselves and so on.

original: 'jig rten pa khams gnyis las 'dod chags dang bra la ba yang mngon par 'grub pa'i sbyor ba spangs pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa khams gnyis las 'dod chags dang bra la ba yang mngon par 'grub pa'i sbyor ba spangs pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Even those who are free from attachment to the two realms of desire and form have not abandoned the preparation for actualizing the meditative attainment of cessation.

original: de dag gang 'phags pa'i shes rab kyis spangs pa de ni spangs pa yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gang 'phags pa'i shes rab kyis spangs pa de ni spangs pa yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But those who have abandoned it through the wisdom of the ƒÅryas have abandoned it.

original: yang na byung ba ni dgra bcom pa'o zhes bya ba ni byung ba dang skyes zin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩsrid pa tshol ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na byung ba ni dgra bcom pa'o zhes bya ba ni byung ba dang skyes zin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to // srid pa tshol ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Or, ‚Äúarisen‚Äù means an arhat, that is, one who has already arisen and been born.

original: khams gsum las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khams gsum las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They do not seek existence because they are free from attachment to the three realms.

original: srid pa tshol ba rnams ni sred pa dang bcas bdag go zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: srid pa tshol ba rnams ni sred pa dang bcas bdag go zhes bya ba la /
translated: Those who seek existence are those who have craving.

original: de dag ni 'dod @323b chags dang ma bral ba'i phyir srid pa tshol ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni 'dod @323b chags dang ma bral ba'i phyir srid pa tshol ba yin no //
translated: They seek existence because they are not free from attachment.üîΩHow many nutriments sustain sentient beings who have already arisen?

original: yang zas du zhig na sems can byung ba rnams gnas par byed pa yin zhes bya ba ni sems can skyes pa rnams gnas pa'i rgyu yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang zas du zhig na sems can byung ba rnams gnas par byed pa yin zhes bya ba ni sems can skyes pa rnams gnas pa'i rgyu yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means they are the cause for the continuation of sentient beings who have already been born.

original: du zhig ni srid pa tshol ba rnams la phan 'dogs par byed pa yin zhes bya ba ni yang srid pa tshol ba rnams kyi yang srid pa mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: du zhig ni srid pa tshol ba rnams la phan 'dogs par byed pa yin zhes bya ba ni yang srid pa tshol ba rnams kyi yang srid pa mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: How many benefit those who seek existence?üîΩThose who seek existence are those who seek rebirth.

original: thams cad kyang gnyis ka yin no zhes bya ba'i zas bzhi char yang sems can byung ba rnams gnas par byed pa dang / srid pa tshol bar byed pa rnams la phan 'dogs par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyang gnyis ka yin no zhes bya ba'i zas bzhi char yang sems can byung ba rnams gnas par byed pa dang / srid pa tshol bar byed pa rnams la phan 'dogs par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The four types of nutriment benefit those who seek existence because all four types of nutriment benefit those who seek existence and those who have already attained existence.

original: yid la sems pa ni las kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: yid la sems pa ni las kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: Mental intention is the nature of karma and

original: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rigs pa dang / rnam par shes pa ni de dang 'bras bu gcig pa'i phyir dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba yin pa'i phyir srid pa tshol ba rnams la phan 'dogs la rag na /
analyzed: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rigs pa dang / rnam par shes pa ni de dang 'bras bu gcig pa'i phyir dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba yin pa'i phyir srid pa tshol ba rnams la phan 'dogs la rag na /
translated: the faculty of thought and the consciousness that is concomitant with it are the same result as that and are virtuous or nonvirtuous because they benefit those who seek existence.

original: kham gyi zas kyi bdag nyid ma yin zhing lung du ma bstan pa go ji ltar srid pa tshol bar byed pa rnams la phan 'dogs par byed par brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: kham gyi zas kyi bdag nyid ma yin zhing lung du ma bstan pa go ji ltar srid pa tshol bar byed pa rnams la phan 'dogs par byed par brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: How can it be that the food of meditative absorption, which is not of the nature of oral food and is indeterminate, benefits those who seek existence?üîΩTherefore, it is said:

original: de'i phyir kham gyi zas kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir kham gyi zas kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe food of meditative absorption is also like that.‚Äù

original: don 'di ni shes par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don 'di ni shes par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to understand this point,üîΩthe BhagavƒÅn said:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis zas bzhi ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis zas bzhi ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe four foods are the root of sickness, boils, andüîΩdeath.‚Äù

original: nad dang 'bras dang rga shi rnams ni mdo 'di las yang 'byung ba nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i rnam grangs kyi tshig tu gsungs te /
analyzed: nad dang 'bras dang rga shi rnams ni mdo 'di las yang 'byung ba nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i rnam grangs kyi tshig tu gsungs te /
translated: In this s≈´tra, sickness, boils, and death are stated as synonyms for the five appropriated aggregates.
